description:
I don't usually post reviews but this little hole in wall restaurant is honestly my favorite restaurant as of today. Their pad thai, yellow curry, and coconut fried rice is amazing!! Although it is a bit pricey, the richness of the flavor is truly amazing, and that's what makes it worth it. 

Came here at around 6pm on a Monday and it's surprisingly empty. Our server was courteous and quick, and our food came almost as soon as we ordered. 

I would highly recommend coming here if you're ever craving Thai food!
author: Jasmin C.

description:
It's ok for the price. Calamari and appetizers was kind of expensive, just like the price of the fried rice/pad thai/curry  The calamari was nothing special.

We ordered the mango fried rice. I just want to leave a review for that dish. Chicken was not seasoned well, tasted kind of bland compared to the fried rice. Mango was HARD. Def not ripe and def ruined our hopes of luscious sweet mango chunks in the fried rice. That was why we opt for the mango instead of the coconut...its supposed to be in season!

We ordered the pad kee mao as well. It was ok. For the price, you'd expect a nicer location. For a whole in the wall ambiance, it could be a bit cheaper.

Theres a lot of to go orders the whole time we were there. I guess some people must've really liked it. ‍

For us, we've had better. Maybe we'll come back for the coconut fried rice. Btw we came here bc pampangoena (?) was closed so we went to the closest restaurant with decent reviews.
author: Inez J.

description:
Still 5 stars!

The green curry was excellent, spicy and sweet, and my favorite, pad thai, is still a big winner.

I took my friend from Chile who has never had Thai food, and he loved Zabb!
author: Steve F.

description: I don't know how many times I've gotten here, but somehow I always end up craving their Pad See Ew! It's flavorful (+ chili flakes/sauce), not greasy, and pretty affordable for SF. I usually order take-out, but finally decided to dine in for once, and it was surprisingly nice despite how empty it was since most people do order to-go. The food was actually better than I had ever had it, but it did feel like the portions were slightly smaller for dine-in.
author: Alice C.

description:
Cute small intimate restaurant located in the mission. Its family owned and I immediately felt like I was trying food from a friend's kitchen. 

The staff was attentive but gave us space to talk and enjoy our food.

I ordered the red curry. My party had eggplant and pad thai. Simple dishes but very tasty and descent shareable portions. 

I was most amazed by the price. A dinner for 3 adults who ordered 3 dishes totaled $30ish dollars.

Overall great restaurant, can't wait to go back and try more dishes.
author: Choi C.

description:
I know that there are many who love the food here. There are several things going for the restaurant--they deliver the food quickly inexpensively, the flavors are approachable.  

However, the meals churned out here taste like they have a common pool of sauces drenching pre-cooked meat. The flavors are frontal and basic. Not the complex, punchiness I have come to expect of Thai food.

To be fair,  I don't think they use much MSG or other additives (if they use it at all). So, I will eat here if it were a convenient option. But there are so many other options nearby that we adore that I will not make a special effort to eat here.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: This spot is the shit.    The quality is excellent because everything is made to order.  The food was as good as the service.   I love the food here and will be back to try everything.
author: Chris N.

description:
It's ok.  The service was good.  The open kitchen layout allowed for the customers to enjoy the cooking flavors. 

The food was hit and miss. 

Eggplant with basil has a wonderful sauce.  However, they used regular eggplant which was bitter. The curry lacked body from the lack of using enough coconut milk and curry paste.  The pad kee mao was good.
author: S F.

description:
Food is so good here!! Really authentic, and portions are good. Price point is also decent!

I got the pad kee mow, pork, spicy. It was so good! I usually am not able to finish all of my food, but best believe I scarfed it all down! It was pretty spicy, but hey I asked for spicy, denoted on their menu as . The noodles were great! My problem with pad kee mow sometimes is that the noodles will stick together in clumps and won't get sauced properly, but these didn't come out like that! Or some other places like will have a bunch of broken noodles so that the noodles are really short and you can't really pick it up with a fork, but these aren't like that either! They're really good! If you've never had pad kee mow, definitely try these!

Also tried the Thai green tea and the regular Thai tea! Definitely recommend! As the milk in it helps with the spicyness!

My bestie got the pineapple duck curry, he said it was really good!
author: Eva C.

description: I love Zabb. A neighborhood treasure. Nicest owners in the world. Great food. Great price on lunch specials. Pumpkin curry. Cashew nut chicken. Beef salad... have never ordered anything I didn't like. And they try new appetizers... like tonite it's fried calamari rings.
author: Kristine P.

description: Food as good as ever! But now we can finally order delivery through Eat24. It only took 20 minutes to get my grub!
author: Cliff H.

description: This thai restaurant is the only one close by us which was surprisingly good. Well, There are two thai restaurants on Cortland but one close at 6p and the other only specialized in noodles. The only 3 small complaints was they didn't give us any utensils , napkins or offer any sauce or spice for our Togo. I didn't realized it till I got home looking for chopsticks, forks,etc. there was nothing but the food I order. They usually deliver base off yelp but when calling he said he can't deliver since he didn't have enough help which I understand and last the crispy basil chicken was a bit salty. Overall the rest was surprisingly pretty good. Everyone actually enjoyed it. 3 star but the guy was really nice and there was really only him and one lady working there so it's ok . 4 star for now. Unless it happens again than I will have to update the review. Everyone or restaurants does have their days that doesn't always turn out right.  Besides it was my first time there. I'll take that in consideration and will try them again.  Oh yeah! I forgot to mention that I love their thai green tea. It's really good. Wish they had crystal boba in it lol.
author: Christy V.

description: This is our go-to Thai takeout place in the city - bright spicy flavors and not at all greasy or watery.  We enjoyed the Pumpkin Curry with Chicken, Pad Thai, and Spicy Basil Beef. The service was also great - easy to order and ready to go in 15m! Worth a trip to curb your  Thai craving.
author: Lara B.

description: I wouldve gave them 5 stars but the waitress had added spring rolls to our order, which i did not order and then after that their customer service wasn't so nuce and welcoming. But anyways the food was AMAZING. Just need improvement in the customer service area.
author: Patricia C.

description: Came in during lunch today and had good exoerience w friendly staff and the food was delicious! :)
author: Chrissy O.

description:
Curry was pretty good. Friendly service. Clean restroom. Okay place for lunch- dine in or take off. 

Will I return? Doubt it as I don't image staying in the neighborhood during next visit.
author: Kamonica C.

description:
The food is always fantastic. Hidden gem in the Excelsior. 

Recommend ALL of the curries, the smokey claypot, and the coconut fried rice.

Zabb is a staple in our diets.
author: Stephen S.

description: GREEN THAI ICED TEA IS SOOO GOODDDD!! We ordered the chicken pad kee mao and the spicy crispy basil chicken. The pad kee mao was a little sweet for my liking, but the crispy chicken was delicious! Would definitely come back again-- especially for the green Thai iced tea:)
author: Michelle T.

description: Im an SFNative I stay in eastbay currently but I come here to eat fresh thai food . Its so good!! I tried a few places around east bay none can top this place from there customer service to there food. Always a go to when Im in the city. Faithful  to this place.
author: Ely Z.

description: Took my family for Thai food! It was delicious and he serve was prompt. I am from out of town visiting San Fran. I ordered the Thai Fried Rice with chicken. Portion was good. I wasn't even able to finish my food lol!!
author: Stephanie L.

description: I'm less than 2 miles (approximately 7 minutes according to Google maps) away from the restaurant and I was told they don't deliver to my address. At this point, if I had to drive to get Thai food I wouldn't consider this place.
author: Steven N.

description: Came in on a rainy Saturday night just thirty minutes before closing so the restaurant was super empty besides the couple that walked at the same time. Since there were so little people to tend to, customer service was amazing. I was craving Thai food all day so I expected to get my cravings satisfied as this was the nearest Thai restaurant. I ordered the sweet and sour tofu with a side of brown rice. Food came in fairly quickly and I started eating right away. Right off the bat, I could tell it wasn't the mainstream of sweet and sour I was expecting. The dish had lots of veggies to it which I'm fine with but it didn't really have amazing flavors. I was thinking it lacked something but I just don't know what. None the less I finished most of it I'd say but my cravings were definitely not satisfied. If you're looking for the mainstream Thai restaurants, this is not for you.
author: Lisa W.

description: I have loved this place since trying out their green Thai iced tea one Friday evening after attempting to go to another restaurant that was closed that day. This green Thai iced tea is addicting, and the first I've ever tried anywhere. Their fried rice, Pad kee mow, and pineapple lamb curry will keep me coming back over and over. Their service is good and I can tell they really want to keep a high standard. The two times I've been here were both on Fridays. There was always a table for 2, and the crowd is respectful, not rowdy, nice, hungry individuals. It is becoming my favorite Thai place in the Daly City area.
author: Alice S.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in the city. I love their hot and sour soup with chicken and jasmine rice
author: James N.

description: Great family place, great prices. The owners are so nice. Food is amazing and so traditional. It's a most go to in the  excelsior.
author: Betsy P.

description:
Delicious meal, and a phenomenal find! I'd go back in a minute. My only regret was portion size, being on the smaller side, and that's the only reason for four stars. Otherwise, excellent.

Let me start with the fact that this visit was totally random. We just drove up north to escape the heat in the valley, and ended up in the city of SF. Driving up north on Mission St., I've noticed an available parking spot - right across the street from Zabb - and our choice has been made.

Zabb looks very much inviting as you step in, it's well lit and spacious. We were the only dining party and it felt good. Our server was courteous. We ordered coconut milk soup Tom Kha Kai $8.99 with beef $1 and Red curry $8.99 with beef $1, plus two brown rice $2 each.

Both Tom Kha Kai and Red curry arrived freshly cooked and just right. What I mean by that is neither dish seemed to have been pre cooked or simply heated up, nor were they overly salty, as is often the case. Everything has been freshly made.

Tom Kha arrived in authentic ceramic bowl with plenty of fresh veggies (not your usual canned mini corn), including uncommon and tasty kinds, like sautéed eggplant and cabbage. Very flavorful broth and not overwhelming its individual ingredients.

Red curry arrived in refreshing sauce with coconut milk, eggplant, carrots, bell paper, topped with bamboo shoots and sprinkled with fresh basil, served in contemporary white ceramic bowl.

Brown rice individually portioned in metallic bowls with lids. Clean white plates and cups were also set out for us, and two glasses of water. The service was good and attentive.

We enjoyed our meal, and after it had been finished, we've spent some time just relaxing and chatting. I bookmarked Zabb for future visits. Delectable Thai cuisine, my favorite!
author: Grey R.

description: Great food and Super friendly service!! We ordered 5 or 6 different items and all were delicious!! We will have them cater our school event at the beginning of the year and will update yelp after.
author: Justin V.

description: I came here with my friends on a late weekday night and even though it was almost closing time, the service was good. I had the salmon special, which was not included on the menu but was on the board of the day's specials. The fish was cooked well, there was a good amount of rice, and a nice salad. My friends enjoyed their food as well and the price is decent.
author: Namie C.

description:
The rating is solely based on the food an my experience.

Got here about thirty minutes after its opening and I was surprised to find that there were no customers. I found a seat to the side and asked for a cup of water. As I waited I noticed that this place seemed a bit outdated on the inside. A touch of paint and some paintings could really make this place more vibrant! 

There were only two people working when I arrived, a server and cook. I was pleasantly surprised to seem that the cook was a woman. I don't see that too often which made for a nice change.

I ordered the Pad Kea Moa because that is my favorite. 

I was ready for my meal but in waiting I enjoyed the wait by observing the rest of the business. I thought this place would be more busy but it was nice to have this place primarily to myself. 

When the food arrived I was ready to eat. It was not like the other plates that I have had before in that the beef seemed less and there were more peppers!! I guess that is just the luck of the draw kind of deal. I enjoyed the meal but it was nothing to 'BRAG" about in any way. 

Just a filling lunch that made the day. I would have to try another dish here to determine if this place is worth another try. 

I left with my belly stuffed and my faced pleased.
author: Robert F.

description:
We live in the neighborhood.  We were lazy.  And so we found ourselves here for the first time.  I still remember when this used to be a pretty good Vietnamese place many years ago.

Zabb unfortunately offers a disappointing representation of what Thai food should taste like.  We had the curry egg noodle dish and the spicy basil crispy chicken, plus a Thai Green Iced Tea.  There is like, no heat or any unique Thai flavor to their food whatsoever.  I've loved Khao Soi ever since having it in Thailand - this was not even close.  The chicken dish was a bit on the oily side and not very crispy.  The drink was beyond bland.

Can we please get more decent restaurants out here?  Until then, I guess I'll continue heading further down Mission for a burrito or some Hawaiian drive-in next time I want a quick meal.
author: Vanessa C.

description: This place had no wait on a Friday night, which is something I can always appreciate. Finding parking wasn't bad, which is some extra points considering the area. The staff was friendly and ready to give recommendations. We had the spicy basil chicken. It was so flavorful and really good. We also had the beef fried rice. I was not a big fan of this one as I thought it could've been more flavorful. The portions are small in comparison to other Thai restaurants. Overall, worth stopping by and checking out.
author: Antonella H.

description: Got pumpkin curry and mango fried rice ! First time here and the food was great. Would definitely come back !
author: Carmen V.

description: Food is not bad though the service is subpar. Curry dishes do not include steamed rice.
author: Bruce C.

description: the food was very freshly made, served in big amounts, the boss was kind and polite, while the taste was too sweet for me ,and too much oil. I guess they would be very delicious if we order half sugar and half oil
author: 群

description: I really like this place. We came here on a Monday evening and it was pretty empty. However, the food came out quickly and was very good. We ordered a side of rice, pork pumpkin curry, and chicken pad se ew. It was all very very good. On top of it, the guy who was serving us was very kind and I really appreciated this. I'd definitely come back here. That pumpkin curry was delicious. Oh and also! I'm not sure why this place is rated a $$ restaurant. I think it's a $ restaurant personally as a majority of the dishes are under $10. I would say 90% of their base menu is, unless you want a special meat such as beef or seafood. :)
author: Julie L.

description: Friendly staff and clean environment. Had the pumpkin curry and mango fried rice. Both well done dishes.
author: Josh A.

description:
I would love to give them more stars, but their food was just tooooo salty. 
We ordered pork larb, duck curry, and eggplant basil. We TRIED to order the Thai green tea, but that order went wrong.
A nice Thai girl attempted to take our drink order, but she just didn't understand us much. She had to grab the chef, turned into waiter, to take the order.. The Thai tea didn't come out green, but we didn't want to bother them much, so we kindly accosted.  
The pork larb was really salty.. But it had great flavor minus the salt! On top of that, they handed us the larb without any veges on the side. Can you imagine an already overly salted dish that I couldn't cut the salt content with fresh greens? That sucked. When I finally got the waitress' attention, she didn't understand what I was asking for and had to grab the chef/waiter. He Said they ran out of lettuce and had cabbage only. Sure. I was desperate. It kinda worked nicely with the larb. The bittery crunch from the cabbage combined with the minced beef paired well. I wanted to ask for fresh basil as well, but I gave up. 
The eggplant basil was just as salty as the larb, if it wasn't as salty, it would have been a 4 star dish. Great flavor, thick sauce that can coat grains of rice... The duck curry wasn't salty... But lacked that "oomph" that I look for when I eat curry. It tasted watered down and the consistency wasn't as thick as the eggplant dish. AND, the pineapples in there made the dish oddly sweet.. I couldn't coat my rice in the curry soup.. I pretty much slurped the dish up. 
Unfortunately, this wasn't a hit for me. I should have asked the chef to go light on the salt, I did come upon a review or two with the same complaint. But 2 stars for their small business and running a restaurant in the Mission!
author: Maria C.

description:
HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE. 

I mean honestly, it's so hard to disappoint me, but this joint has got a way of its own. 

Food was so bland that it made it hard to swallow. What could have been harder to swallow?? The horrible customer service. 

When my mother and I attempted to comment on the papaya salad, the waiter came at us sideways! He quickly stated, "You don't know what Thai food is. You don't know what it's supposed to taste like." Umm FYI, I frequent MANY Thai restaurants from the Bay to LA. It's frankly my favorite kind of food. I think I'd know what Papaya salad is supposed to taste like, or what it's not supposed to taste like!! 

My biggest qualm was with the service. I don't understand how they have so many stars... Quick to blame the customer for subpar food quality and taste. Big ass red flag for me. Never ever coming back. Ever. 

***Plot twist: The server comes on Yelp to talk more crap about how we don't know what Thai food should taste like, and how we were rude. Let me just say: 

1) Why would the first sentence of your comment include an insult toward my mother? I see that you changed "ugly mother" into "unhappy face mom". Not only is it classless and tasteless to comment on someone's mother's appearance just because you're unhappy with a review, it is simply childish. 

2) My mother first ASKED you about the tomato being old. From that point on, you opened your mouth and ranted on and on senselessly about how we didn't know what papaya salad would taste like, and that some Thai food places make salad one way, and others, another way. 

Just to be clear, the tomato was OLD. We understand that you use a mortar to smash the tomato. But if it tastes like its old, we have the right to simply question whether it is or not. SECONDLY, instead of simply addressing our concern with courtesy and service, you turned the entire situation on your customer. Do you have any idea what a quality restaurant is? 

3) You never apologized like you said you did in your comment. You never attempted to mitigate the situation. All you did is pull the classic "if the customer doesn't like it, it's because something's wrong with them." Instead, you should change your mentality and learn from what your customers have to say.

You even say, "How am I supposed to know what you like?" For starters, when we tell you that the papaya salad is lacking spice and flavor, your first step should be to take the dish back and adjust it. 

4) You say your food is good for everyone... What kind of statement is that? There are many reviews stating your food is bland, subpar, just "ok" tasteless, and the like. Like I said, it's beyond me how you have 4 stars-- your review is only a glimpse into what service is like. I hope after reading this more people will see what they're getting themselves into, and keep away from the joke you call a restaurant.

As for my reviews, it takes a lot for me to write a negative review. Congratulate yourself, at least you have some kind of accomplishment to celebrate. 

P.S. I didn't comment on the foul smelling odor that slaps you in the face when you walk in. So fix that shit, too.

3-26-16
Zabb Thai's server just edited his review for the THIRD time. He obviously has thought twice about the insulting comments he left about my mother. Even still, you can see his complete lack of courtesy and customer service. Done.
author: Amirah Q.

description: Great service and awesome food! Food always looks and tastes amazing. Would recommend the spicy fried chick ones over rice and a Thai iced tea.
author: Jose G.

description: The food is soo good! Everything tasted so fresh and they were very accommodating with making very mild food for the little ones and nice and spicy food for those of us who can handle it. The satay is delicious! The coconut milk soup was delicious!
author: Christiana G.

description:
YUM! I was stuck home sick. A friend said he'd grab me some soup. I'd heard that Zaab was good from an acquaintance just the day before and thought I would try it out.

I got the hot & sour soup. It was nicely spicy. Nothing obscene. Nice veggies, tofu, good flavor.  I also ordered veggie pad see ew. It was really nice. Good texture to the noodles and good flavor. I dislike weak tasting Thai food. Gimme dat spice! 

I will be back here to check it out in person. The soup made me feel so, so much better and prices are reasonable. 

Cootz OUT! 

({})
author: Cooter T.

description:
Guess Friday nights with 5 tables is really busy for this not super tiny at all establishment. The server commented that I'd have to wait a long while when I asked for a to go order really insisting I not order. I asked how long and she said 15-20min or maybe more.  Too bad that honesty(?) in suggestion and attitude turned off a customer.  I read reviews and really wanted to try the tom yum noodle soup and larb gai.

I even ordered the green Thai iced tea drink that I wanted to try. She seemed hesitant.  No thank you either.  Although the transaction was not rude either.  Am giving plus one star for the atmosphere-seems that a lot of people may have liked it although it must be hard to have two cooks with maybe about 10 waiting plates-wonder everything cooked to order versus some items maybe prepared ahead to quicken the process without sacrificing quality and taste and chasing customers away... also although the drink is about 16oz (uS kiddie cup sized) and mostly ice and cream-not enough tea for $2.50, I thought it was okay in tea strength and taste.  Maybe next time less cream more tea?

Sorry, I'll likely  not be back unless invited by friends in the area ...at which point I'll look forward to increase my review's number of stars.  So for now tonight I will drive across town to the TL to another Thai restaurant for my food.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: I ordered chicken lard that's my favorite dish of Thai cuisine, it's not spicy it's a good dish with rice the steamed rice is so good it's soft but not wet it's a lit bit chewy as rice supposed to be. I prefer strong flavor I wish it's more spicy maybe I should ask next time, when I eat the flavor remind me of Chinese food, maybe because the chef is Chinese
author: 凯淇

description: Sat down to eat on a Monday night with a friend, I got dinner and she got dessert. Asked the waiter for recommendations as I'm gluten free by way of celiac, and was pointed to a few dishes that would work. Ended up getting a noodle dish that was so good, my friend ate half of it even though she wasn't hungry. Prices were reasonable, service good, food tasty, will come back.
author: Erik H.

description:
This place is located in an area where parking can be scarce, granted, I went there at 6:00 p.m. 

The menu looked really intriguing (I wanted to order every f'ing thing), but I ended up ordering the Spicy Eggplant dish with veggies served with Garlic Rice. 

The veggies in the Spicy Eggplant were chunky which made the dish have a really meaty texture. Despite the name, the dish wasn't very spicy at all (kind of a bummer, but they give you an array of condiments to sprinkle on). 

The Garlic Rice was pretty damn good. It has crunchy bits of chopped up garlic and just the right amount of salt (which is all types of good in my book.) 

All in all, I'm definitely a fan of this place. I only gave 4 stars because the portion sizes were a little small, but other than that, it was all good.
author: Leilani K.

description:
When it's pouring and you're looking for a quick meal on a Sunday afternoon, your options are slim to none at 2:45pm. As most places were closed or closing soon, we stumbled upon Zabb Thai Cuisine hungry and soaked. (Parking was a pain in the peach, by the way). We ordered two dishes: Coconut Soup with Seafood and the Basil Pork. The soup was good, but the Basil Pork was lacking in basil AND flavor. Perhaps its because we ordered the dish "mild," but mild does not mean NOT spicy or NO flavor. Or NO basil ***angry face here***

Well, I'm never one to waste food - especially when I can't motivate myself to pack a lunch every day. So I had a second round of Basil Pork on Monday for lunch and surprise, surprise! It tasted better as leftovers. I don't know if that's a good or a bad thing, but it happened. So I'm telling you.

For a restaurant with only 3 parties, the service was terrible. No checking in or water refills -- and good luck if you want to get a box or your check at the end of the meal. So, here's my tip: ask for some spice, eat your leftovers, and bring your own bell for service.
author: Jane L.

description: Pretty mediocre. Can't seem to find a really good Thai spot in the city. I had the tofu pad se ew that was average. Nothing too good. The pad Thai was disappointing, containing barely any tofu and a rather odd taste.
author: Julia A.

description:
We ordered my last lunch with the weekend crew from this place because the pumpkin curry got good reviews on Yelp. Our order was to-go in party-size trays:

Pumpkin curry - a little thinner than I am used to, but good flavor and nice chunks of pumpkin. Chicken was a little lacking, but pretty good overall.

Pad Thai - slightly too vinegary, but that didn't stop me from devouring a bunch!

Decent prices and a solid thai meal.
author: Leana L.

description:
Ordered to go from here yesterday. Did a quick look through in the menu but basically already knew what I wanted. Ordered the Tom Kha (listed as coconut soup) with tofu, the pumpkin curry with prawns, and the pineapple fried rice with prawns. +$1 for prawns which is fine with me! 

Easy to order on the phone. They just asked me for my phone number and order. Food was already done by the time I got there. Its a spot on the corner and there was a full on "garage" sale going on next to it by this little old lady. 

Their pineapple fried rice was the weirdest I've ever seen and their curry is VERY watery. Just as watery as the soup. I saw that they labeled the curry and soup containers which I thought was kind of silly but then realized they probably did that on purpose knowing their curry was the same consistency as the soup. Tom Kha was very good. I've never had a bad one though. Flavor of the curry was good except it was just too watery and only four pieces of pumpkin.

I feel like the total came out to be a lot too like $37 for three items? I don't know actually I ordered five items at Lers Ros and it was $70 so I guess its on par with other thai places.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
A solid option for those in the Excelsior. I've walked past this place for years, and the other day I thought to get delivery ... order-taker on the phone was pleasant, delivery guy was pretty quick to turn up ... 

Food was middle of the road ... like I said, a solid option.
author: Henry M.

description: This is our neighborhood Thai food spot. Always fresh and consistently good. Plus they are very friendly. I've taken various friends and family there, and they all have said how much they enjoyed the food. Try it!
author: Brett F.

description: Tasty food for a neighborhood spot and affordable. The staff is very sweet and accommodating!!!
author: Guy B.

description: Very nice staff. Excellent food. One of the best curry I have had. I strongly recommed.
author: Frank D.

description:
Zabb is your average Thai food! They have all of the standard options from rices to noodles and soups. Parking on the streets may be difficult but not impossible.

I ordered the chicken pumpkin curry with a side of rice. The pumpkin itself was cooked really well, but I found the curry a bit watered down. The chicken was also cooked pretty well (not overlooked).

I would probably come back here to check out the rest of the menu at a later time. The food isn't bad, but didn't blow me away.
author: Jeff M.

description:
We came here last night to celebrate a birthday. I made the reservations ahead of time for a party of 12. We arrived promptly at 6pm and our table was ready.

The food: we ordered a variety of dishes and appetizers. We started off with spring rolls, crispy tofu, and lucky bags. These were really good while waiting for the rest of our party to arrive. I had the spicy basil crispy chicken and asked for extra spicy. Just to let you know, their level of spiciness isn't enough so ask for some chili powder for that extra kick. I like my thai food extra spicy! The chicken was really good. I also tried the paid thai and the pad see ew which are pretty popular dishes. I recommend ordering them. Their portions are also really large and a few of us had leftovers.

Service: Ben (the owner) is a very hard working guy. He was doing everything from helping out in the kitchen (his wife is the cook) to refilling our waters. He was also busy keeping up with all of our orders. He's also very nice and when we mentioned it was our friend's birthday, he gave him a free glass of thai iced tea and ice cream at the end. Also in the past when we ordered delivery, he would also make the deliveries.

Price: You'll be pleasantly surprised with the prices here. They are extremely reasonable and our group spent under $20 per person after taxes and gratuity.

Location: We picked this place because it was conveniently located. We all live around here and it was easier to gather up at this place.
author: Tim G.

description:
I love Thai food and having moved around a bit, have tried a fair number of Thai restaurants. That said, Zabb's pad thai is the best I've had in recent memory. We also ordered the pad kee mao with calamari and the calamari was fresh and tender.
Sure, Zabb may not have the crazy variety of menu choices (compared to let's say Krung Thai in San Jose) but this is one solid Thai spot. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Gina D.

description: Coconut milk soup is great. And now they have catfish! Love their spicy eggplant! Pad See ew always good with duck. Yummy. And mango sticky rice is pretty good. :) Very homely. But I live so close i order take out and eat on the couch :)
author: Rob L.

description:
We ordered for delivery tonight. Pumpkin Curry, Coconut Milk Soup, Mango Fried Rice, Green & Thai Iced Tea. First off the delivery was very fast and he took my credit card over the phone. (They usually take it for dine in only and cash on delivery).
Pumpkin Curry and Coconut Milk soup was on point. My son and I could not get enough of it. So much flavor and just the right heat, chunks of pumpkin and veggies with chicken (our choice of meat). The Mango Fried rice was just ok. Nothing special plus the cashew in there was burnt. As in its black and bitter. No..no... bueno! The teas were really good but half of it was all ice. Food is a little pricey. Paid $38.12 total. Over all, I give it 3 stars.
author: Len P.

description:
I visited my family in SF. Stopped by here randomly... If you want the Green Apple Splatters of diarrhea, I highly recommend this garbage.
Horrible representation of Thai cuisine. Only thing worse is a Trump rally which is how my stomach now feels
author: Bryan K.

description:
I'm solely writing this review on the basis of their poor service. Once I walked in and Iwas told me they were closing at 830pm when they usually close at 930. There were customers ordering at the front desk. When they told me they were somewhat rude, maybe it's a language issue who knows. I just called now and they told me they are not delivering tonight and asked me if I can pick up the order. 

Now the food is actually pretty good but with so many food choices in San Francisco why should you settle for subpar service.

They just lost a customer. 

Good luck Zabb Cuisine
author: Angel R.

description:
Came on a Sunday with my hubby, second time, for lunch. First time was with a friend for dinner. They said they don't have lunch specials on Sunday when we walked in even though their menu posted on the front window states lunch specials "every day". We were told to choose from the Sunday dinner menu. I wanted the coconut noodle soup which they don't offer during dinner and so I said to my hubby, if they don't have the coconut noodle soup then i'm going to leave. I think they picked that up and when they took my order, I asked them if they have it and they said they can make it for me. 

I would have been so pissed if they didn't make it for me but they did and now I'm super satisfied. The soup itself was a bit sour which I wasn't expecting but it was good none-the-less. The noodles are like pho so if you like pho and coconut, this is the choice for you. I don't understand how they can survive with just a few (2-3) patrons every time i pass by. Perhaps that's why they use trickery on their patrons to keep afloat? 

I wouldn't come back again unless I was dying for some coconut noodle soup............
author: Jenz Z.

description: I've been going to Zabb for more more than 10 years. I love the food and service. Reasonable prices and good food--just like the Thai food I eat when I go to Thailand. It's a nice atmosphere inside and their food presentations are really good.  I highly suggest going to this restaurant.
author: Marc S.

description:
...dropped in for the first time to say hello to the owners who i know but i was hungry, too...i said, "cook me whatever dish (to go) that will make me come back."...i live in the central mission so i was serious about that comment... 

...got home and enjoyed curry chicken with pumpkin with rice...omg...good as it gets...def will go back for a whole meal...
author: Bob L.

description:
This place is one of those hidden hole-in-the wall gems that you find randomly! 

The food here is great and I would definitely recommend this place for just a quick stop to eat.
author: Steven C.

description:
Went here for a lunch outing with coworkers. Decided to grab a quick bite.

Very typical fare when trying out a Thai restaurant. Similar decor as most places off of Mission with not much dressing and just a simple dine in experience. We went around 12:30 which would be expectant of a lunch rush. Being the only diners in doesn't always fare well but they did seem to be busting out quite a bit of to-go orders.

I had tried the Coconut Milk Soup and the Pra-ram lunch special with Fried Tofu and Brown Rice. Abundance of food choices at about $7.99/special, this is solid selection for Thai food. The Coconut Milk had a mild coconut taste, but I usually prefer it to be a little bit creamier. Personal preference. The dish is served in about four squares, each giving just a little bit of a taste of everything. I wish the serving sizes were just a little bit bigger but at the price, is not such a bad deal. May make another stop to try something different as this will be one of the few, easily accessible Thai places around the area.
author: Eric L.

description:
I really do not like this place, I ordered coffee, but no coffee flavor. Food low quality and high prices. Not worth mentioning.

我真的不喜歡這個地方，我點了咖啡，但沒有咖啡味。 食物高價格低質量, 不值一提.
author: Eric W.

description: Good, tasty Thai food. Solid and pleasant without being spectacular, but recommended for the area. It looks like a lot of their business is takeout or delivery, as the dining room tends to be pretty quiet.
author: Preston G.

description:
Crap...I'm torn at how to rate this place. The food is kind of a 3, but generally I like the owners and their commitment to the community. So...my 4 is with this note in mind. I'd normally give it a 3 based on food. 

I work in the Excelsior, and was running between meetings. Hectic workday, and I was looking for a place to get food really quickly so I can run to the next thing. I'd been meaning to try Zabb for a while, and ordered to-go, on my way back. Calling in was fine - I had an issue when I called it Zabb Thai rather than Zabb Cuisine. I was confused. The person on the other line was confused.

Upon basic yelp search, I saw that the Pumpkin Curry was touted as being delicious, so I decided to try that with chicken. Had to order rice on the side, because the curry doesn't come with rice. Which. Always confuses me. What person has curry with no rice or starch? Just drink it like a soup? Odd.

The food was just ok. The curry was flavorful, but many items in there over cooked. The pumpkin (kabocha!) was a bit dry, which is confusing because it's sitting in a batch of curry. Maybe it was cooked to death. The chicken was super thinly sliced which is normally good...but it was super over cooked as well. Maybe if I had gotten it fresh and it didnt have the carry-over heat from treking back to my office. 

The rice itself...was pretty bad. It was split and overly hard. Thank god the curry was there to moisten it. I'm not sure if its Zabb's fault though. Rice in general has been really bad (not just here, but purchased outside too. Don't buy those 50lbs of rice any time soon!).
author: Lily W.

description: Great food & incredibly friendly staff. The food has wonderful flavor. This place is a neighborhood must! I especially liked the the penang curry & mango fried rice.
author: Katana D.

description: Food tastes good.  Price is reasonable.  Service is friendly and gives good recommendation.
author: Stanley L.

description: This is my go to Thai place in my neighborhood. Location is convenient, right off of Silver & mission. I always get the Pad see ew with shrimp or scallops, my personal favorite. The green curry is to die for & so is the coconut soup. Would recommend although I would order vegetables instead of seafood if you were opting for one or the other.
author: Jamie Z.

description: We were excited to try Zabb out because of its positive reviews, so we got take-out from here the other night. Although they were punctual, the food was significantly subpar. We got curry, eggplant and pad thai. All of it was greasy and bland. Definitely will not come here again.
author: Bella S.

description: Zabb Thai Cuisine has been in Excelsior neighborhood for 9 years. I don't have to go very far to get delicious Thai cuisine and excellent service. Ben has dedicated his time to keeping this quality restaurant in our neighborhood. Addy is the chef and consistently puts out delicious dishes with fresh and quality ingredients. My favorite are the papaya salad, crispy tofu, yellow curry, Pad Thai, both the hot and sour soup and the coconut soup. Oh, and top it off with a Singha beer. Always good for pick up after work or a nice dinner close to home. I also appreciate their clean environment and friendly service. Thank you Ben and Addy for staying local. I hope you never leave.
author: Rosalia R.

description: Eh.  Not my favorite Thai place but not bad either.  It's a decent little neighborhood spot.  I would give it 3.5 stars.
author: Lisa L.

description:
My GF and I came here on whim after looking on our yelp app. We were both a bit skeptical at first because of the area and because of the reviews. Nevertheless, we are not fans of any Thai restaurants that are in Daly City and we wanted to try something different than Osha in Glen Park. What a diamond in the rough! =)

B R I E F  S U M M A R Y
-- Location isn't greatest
-- Parking isn't greatest (typical of San Francisco)
-- Park on Mission or on the side residential streets
-- Metered parking on some of the side streets (nice when it's FREE)
-- Not busy at all on a Monday night =)
-- Menu is very detailed and lists SPICY (don't order if you don't like spice!)
-- Service is pretty relaxed but still attentive when you need it
-- Beef salad was very flavorful, traditional and spicy! (recommend)
-- Spicy string beans with chicken were packed with flavor and a bit "wetter" than other versions I've had (still recommend)
-- Chicken green curry was creamy, spicy and YUMMY (recommend)
-- Fried Banana and ice cream was sweet enough but didn't like the sprinkles (still recommend)
-- Glad to have met one of the owners and make some small talk
-- Bill didn't break the bank!

Luckily we found parking only a block away. Again, the area isn't the best but I was happy to see that it wasn't busy. I almost prefer "Mom and Pop" Thai restaurants because their flavors are a bit more authentic and true.

B E E F  S A L A D: This was the 1st beef salad that reminded me of the very first time I had some. Normally when I order beef salad there's lettuce, this came with cabbage. The flavors contained so much depth mixing the freshness of the beef with lime and chili. The spice level was spot on, not too much but enough to say hello. It was such a fresh yet meaty dish to start off with. I definitely was looking forward to the rest of the meal.

S P I C Y  S T R I N G  B E A N S: This is a more recent favorite dish for us to order. It has spicy in the name so you know the heat is coming. Surprisingly it wasn't as spicy as the beef salad. Still great flavor and it had more of a sauce versus a dry fried string bean. 

G R E E N  C U R R Y: Probably one of my biggest complaints when ordering green curry is that it's not very thick or creamy, it's watery. I don't like watery curry at all. I was very happy to see the thickness and creaminess of our chicken green curry. It wasn't as spicy as expected so I asked for some prick nam blah and wow it definitely heated me up. I loved spice mixed with chicken, bell peppers and eggplant.

D E S S E R T: The fried banana is in balls almost like donuts. The dough wasn't too much but definitely on the donut-ish side of things. They topped it with honey and sprinkles. I like that the honey added a nice sweetness but the sprinkles were kind of annoying. The coconut ice cream was great and it wasn't super hard. Overall it was a nice dessert to end a spicy meal.

As of late, I've kind of been getting over the more modern Osha in Glen Park and have been looking for a more authentic and traditional Thai restaurant. I've definitely found this in Zabb. During my conversation with the owner, I asked what Zabb meant and he told me that it meant spicy and delicious in Thai. We also talked about Thailand and other things. It was nice to learn something about the restaurant. I'll definitely be back in the future to try more of their menu.
author: Daniel D.

description: Ordered grilled mahi special, really good and tasty. My husband ordered praram with sticky rice and he said that its good and the peanut sauce is just right. The Thai iced tea is great and not too sweet. Their Thai samosas are a little small and not too stuffy but the sauce on the side with veggies made up for it. Overall, the food is great and we now have a new go to Thai restaurant. The service is great and fast. Staff are friendly. I'm so glad I yelped this place. Thanks yelp!
author: Glenna C.

description: It's what you'd expect for Thai food. Lots of favor. I didn't really care for the Pai Thai the sauce is a little to thick.
author: Leah M.

description: The food was okish but the size of the portions were very small. The service was also ok. The food didn't really have much sauce for a prawn dish my dad ordered. Don't come here if you have a normal appetite.
author: Arjun P.

description: We thoroughly enjoyed this place. Four of us had dinner there on Monday evening. We ordered two bowls of coconut soup, one order of pad see ew, and panang curry. All hot and filling and just what we were looking for.
author: Alanna F.

description: I only had the spring rolls, pad Thai, green curry, and red curry. Overall the spring rolls and pad Thai were fine, if a little on the greasy side. The curries were inexcusable. They were so runny and oily. It was disgusting. I'm attaching a couple of pictures. I wanted to like this place because it's close, but darn, I won't be back
author: Dan E.

description: Stopped in because it was close by and the reviews on Yelp were good. We were the only people in the place, but it was 3:30 in the afternoon. The pumpkin curry was delicious, not too sweet. The yellow chicken curry was a little bland, and could use the addition of tomato and pineapple. Service was good, friendly and quick.
author: Victoria C.

description: Some of the best Thai food I've ever had. They have some very unique but amazing items. The curry noodles are to die for! Service is also top notch!
author: Maya G.

description: Greta food and the chef is award winning. Although there is only one chef I never feel like I'm waiting very long.
author: Vertel J.

description: I'm annoyed. Why does this place have a $$ rating on yelp? I like to limit my Thai eating to $ so I've been avoiding this place the whole damn time I've lived like 5 mins away from this completely legit $ Thai place. Food was great, wouldn't really change a thing. $7.99 for most of the entrees, just as cheap if not cheaper than other Thai places in sf.  Plus, only $1 extra to have prawns in an entree- great deal. Solid food, clean restaurant- my new Thai spot.
author: Emma H.

description:
Located in the heart of Excelsior near the public library. 

There is plenty of metered street parking on Mission or if you go into the side streets there is free residential parking.

Ordered lunch to-go, 3 items, and it was ready within 20 minutes. 

I ordered the chicken curry noodles, the beef pad see ew, and vegetarian spicy eggplant.

Absolutely loved the chicken curry but only downside was that the noodles were overcooked and too soft. The spicy eggplant was also extremely delicious and wasn't too spicy but just a nice little kick. The beef pad see ew was a generous portion and had plenty of beef slices.

Overall, this place is a nice little Thai restaurant in the Excelsior. The prices are not too high and I saw that they also do lunch combos which I'm sure would be well worth your money.

Will try dining in next time.
author: Rebecca T.

description: Eat here once a week since it's right near my work and it's always delicious. Food is fresh and very Tasty. Prices are Uber reasonable. Family owned place with great friendly service. Place is spotlessly clean. Love Zabb!!!
author: Maria R.

description: Phoned in a pick up order here last night. One item was missing and one was wrong, even though I went over It several times. A bit annoying after a long day of work. Luckily, I noticed a curry was missing and just had to wait to have it made. The food was hit or miss. The coconut rice and jasmine rice tasted identical. I wouldn't spend the extra money on it again. The Pad Thai was ok, but tasted too much like ketchup. The Panang curry was decent. The coconut soup was good. I would get it a bit more spicy next time. The spicy eggplant with beef was AMAZING. I might come back just for this it was so good.
author: Jordan H.

description:
We only got to try a few dishes, but the papaya salad was our favorite. It was surprisingly and deliciously "homogenous," where each bite had a little of everything vs. the kind of papaya salad where each fork full might grant you a tomato, or a peanut, or a piece of cabbage. 

When it comes to Thai food, it's all about the balance of the flavors. Zabb's food tends on the sweeter side, but not terribly so. We look forward to trying more items from their menu in the future!
author: Amy C.

description: Food is okay, not bad nor great. Service is so so,I think they're a bit pricey. They serve good tea, actually good ice over tea :)) Please More TEA and less ice. Not my first choice if I wanted to grab a quick lunch.
author: Zara A.

description:
Unremarkable Thai food, at noncompetitive prices.

The menu on Yelp is out of date - a Panang Curry now runs $10, and rice will cost you another $2. We ordered Chicken Satay and received four bite-sized chicken pieces on skewers. They were flavorful and well-cooked, but it was hard to ignore the stingy portioning.

My curry was fine, but not aromatic or distinctive in any way. There was a disappointingly small amount of vegetables and meat in the broth.
author: Joshua A.

description: I consider this place a decent Thai food restaurant. Food is not bad but I definitely had better. The restaurant was pretty empty when I had gone for lunch. Not sure what it's like during dinner but I can not imagine this place being packed, primary because the location. I had the yellow curry with rice. It was pretty good but it was not filling.. I was still hungry after the meal. I would give them 4 stars if the quantity was larger but since it is not, 3 stars it is.
author: John L.

description: I ordered the Pad thai, pad see ew, and thai fried rice. Compared to other thai restaurants I've tried i felt like it was lacking flavor. They gave me really little pad see ew as well. I had all items to go. The pad thai was the best. The only problem is that I paid extra for prawns and they didn't include the prawns in the pad thai, but still charged me. I figured that out after taking it out and arriving home. This place isn't too bad, but its nice to know there's a decent thai food place close to home.
author: Melanie T.

description: They weren't kidding about this pumpkin curry! It has to be the BEST DAMN PUMKIN CURRY I HAVE HAD ,and I have had it at many places!  Thanks again Ben  and Addy!
author: Curtis L.

description:
On Sat night around 7, it was almost empty.  But a few more groups came in within 30 min.
Strange decor, service?? (not bad, just non-existent)
Curry and noodle was good,  Pasta typical.  Appetizer's fried tofu.. that was a rip off...
They have only 2 soup choices, too bad, I was craving for soup.
So in overall the selection for Thai food was a little limited, but it was ok/good, just not great.
The hot thai tea was nice on a cold evening, it came in a large pot.
Parking could be an issue just like anywhere in SF city.
author: Mio F.

description:
Came here last Friday- service was fast but I had better Thai food at some other Thai restaurant. 

I thought the food was kinda salty :)
author: Emil J.

description: The restaurant is cute and the food is very good. Definitely the best Thai food you will find in the area. Parking is a bit difficult to find.
author: Ivania M.

description: First time here had a late lunch with the family price was decent food was very good they accommodated my son just noodles and broth that he wanted so that was a plus
author: Ernesto S.

description: I tried this place because I'm new to the neighborhood and, hey, I had to eat. I was pleasantly surprised at the consistently good quality affordable Thai food. I've only ever ordered to go (they deliver too but you have to pay cash - in the restaurant they take credit cards) so can't speak to the service or experience of eating there. The place is a little spare, but clean (and has a 94 rating!); the people who work there are consistently nice. It's super convenient for me AND the food is really tasty.
author: Judith S.

description:
Thought the servers were sweet! Took care of a split bill well and made it easy for us.

The food is yummy. It's a small little place and definitely nothing too fancy but it was good basic Thai food for when you need that Thai fix.

We recommend the chefs noodle and iced thai coffee overall!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Love the thai green tea, get it every time!  Coconut soup is also delicious, and I can't forget the mango sticky rice. Parking there can be a war zone but it's all worth it.
author: Liz E.

description:
When I lived in the Tendernob I was a Thai food addict.  Within four blocks of my house there were about 15 Thai Restaurants, most with bright appetizing dishes.

Then I moved to Excelsior.

The only Thai game in town here--the food is decent, but I've come to expect DELICIOUS when I think of Thai food.

I tried Chef Noodle with chicken and shrimp--It was OK, but overly fish sauced.  Very stinky.  And today I had the lunch combo with basil beef and spring rolls.  The spring rolls were a bit mushy inside, and the beef was tough, tasted like soy sauce, and was missing that rich basil aroma.

So, while I'm glad I have a low priced Thai place nearby, I definitely can't recommend taking a special trip to the Excelsior to eat this average food.
author: Rocco B.

description:
Disregard others' negative comments on the Pad Thai. I've lived in Thailand and let me tell you this place is legit. Their Pad Thai, avo green curry, pumpkin curry, and mango fried rice are delicious. I'm sure it's all delicious but I haven't had the chance to try everything yet.

The family that owns the place is the nicest and there is never a wait to sit down. This place is great, don't miss out!
author: M. S.

description: Very tasty! Portions were a bit small that's why I did not give it a 5 star but the quality and taste was amazing. The stuffed mushrooms and spicy basil chicken is a must try. The owner and waitstaff are really polite friendly and funny.
author: Nikole D.

description: I come here to get good coconut curry soup.  I have only had the red coconut curry and the coconut soup so I cannot give a rating on the other food but I thought my food was pretty good and for excelsior I can say it is the best. I really liked the service though and that is why I give it 5 stars. They were timely and personal. I will come here again.
author: Amanda G.

description:
I've been ordering delivery from Zaab for two years now.  (They will deliver when they are not busy.)  Tonight Zaab was slammed, so I had to pick-up.  It was great to see such a nice biz owner having a busy night.   It was just owner Ben (sp?), who was cooking and helping w/ tables, one cook, and one server working a place of 40 or so seats.  And I didn't realize the place had scored a 100 (!) on their SF Restaurant Health score.  Totally appeals to my OCD tendencies to clean a kitchen till it's sanitary fresh.

Very cool to watch them make my Tom Ka Gai soup to order.  We ordered spicy string beans, but ordered it mild, which was good b/c it had just enough spice for the kids and husband.  And the mango fried rice was loved by all, even the kid who doesn't care for anything w/ rice (even though she is Asian-go figure).  Also ordered the standard thai dish of satay chicken, and even that seemed exceptional tasty tonight.  

I've lived in SF for 20+ years, and had many a Thai dish.   Zaab is as good as any Thai restaurant I've been too in SF, including Osha and Marnee Thai.  And pooh to those that say the neighborhood is "not so nice".  It's a real neighborhood with all types of peeps- deal w/ it!

Rock on  Zaab!
author: Susie M.

description:
This place is a GREAT local spot. There are not usually very many people inside which is too bad because it is a pretty big space and they keep it very clean. 

We just found out that they do delivery! Usually our go-to take out spot, but hey every once in a while it is nice to have someone bring it to your door. 

The Pad Se Ew is delicious, I am also a huge fan of their thai samosas. I can't remember which curry we ordered last time but it was great. 

You really can't go wrong!
author: Taylor S.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and go to Zaab's all the time. Though their atmosphere and service leave something to be desired, their food is great. 

Would definitely recommend the Pumpkin Curry, Pad Kee Mao, and Spicy Basil. This place is GREAT for take-out on a weeknight.
author: Casey M.

description: Consistently tasty food and very nice staff. Even if it wasn't within walking distance of my house, I would go often!
author: Adam P.

description: I ordered chicken pad Thai, spring rolls and a Thai iced tea. The pad Thai was not good. It's not like it was terrible but it was so bland, no spices, no flavor to the sauce or chicken. The spring roll was fine but 3 little rolls were 7$. The Thai iced tea was the only thing worth ordering again. Service was fine, the inside is open with a solid vibe but I can make bland noodles at home for significantly less.
author: Laticia L.

description:
I bought food from zabb cuisine before and been very surprised at the quality for the price.

However based upon the customer service and atmosphere the restaurant I would not recommend going there.  Tonight I attempted to place an order for delivery.  The man asked for my address and then when he found out I live so close to the restaurant he wondered why I didn't just go in.  I told the man I had had a long day and I did not want to go in and he still asked me why I could not go instead of having it delivered.  The man proceeded to ask why I couldn't go in.  I hung up frustrated with his questions and is utter lack of wanting to make a customer happy.  Based upon this I would not recommend going to the this establishment.  Anyone who doesn't want to deliver to a close customer is someone who doesn't want to do any work and is highly unprofessional.
author: Douglas R.

description: We LOVE Zaab and have been going here for several years, about once a month. My favs are the crispy basil chicken, the samosas, and the massamun (yellow) curry with chicken. My vegetarian daughter loves the clay pot with shrimp (I do too) and either the pumpkin or the avocado curries, with tofu. Also like the pineapple fried rice- a very mild yellow curry flavor- with shrimp (your choice of meat/tofu). The prepare quickly. Alas, delivery area is limited as it takes the cooks away from the kitchen. Note they are closed on Tuesdays, not Mondays like many restaurants.
author: Sue W.

description: Ordered to go for mango fried rice & pineapple fried rice, panang curry and pad Thai. They're all good especially the panang curry. Price for me are cheaper than other Thai restaurants. We'll be back to try the other stuff from their menu list.
author: Sonny Q.

description: We come here a little often since its close to home. Small local food Its really good and decent portions. The ppl there are very nice and friendly in person but kinda short attitude on the phone. We will continue coming here.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
I ordered for the first time tonight, the voice on the other end of the phone was fairly brief. And less friendly than I usually get from other delivery places in the neighborhood.  Not a big deal, could have just been busy. I orders pad Thai, and yellow curry   He remarked that I was at about 19 dollars and the minimum is 20.  Thought that was a bit ....I don't know!   
I orders at 6. And my food arrived at 6:14 the fastest delivery I have ever received. Amazing. I give five stars for fast delivery. And the food is delicious!!   Definitely recommended if you can deal with slightly unfriendly phone service, though the delivery guy was super friendly and pleasant!
author: nathan k.

description:
Unpretentious delicious Thai food. One of those places you are lucky to stumble upon. I mean really who would ever think a restaurant with an odd name called ZABB (means  delicious in Northern Thai) would serve over the top Thai food with great service.
    I was esp delighted with the mango fish coconut rice. A little sweet but overall delicious.  I add my kudos to the pumpkin curry.  If you like veggies the Pra-Ram will be a delight. Perfect cook big pile of fresh veggies with just enough peanut sauce. 
     Never seems to be crowded. Please stay this way.  I'm an x Peace Corps volunteer with two yrs in Thailand '69. 
Bailey from the Big Island
author: Bailey W.

description: To be honest I haven't tried very much on their menu. When I find something I like, I just order it over and over. That being said their Spicy Eggplant with beef is the best in the city. THE BEST. I eat a lot of Thai food too and a lot of eggplant dishes. Actually, I just ordered an eggplant dish from another local place because I forgot Zabb is closed today and as I'm eating it now, it's just not the same. Zabb is also the least expensive in the area I think. Anyway, there's something about it's flavor... Soooo good. And so different from other places. I also get their Green Tea Thai ice tea. Delicious.
author: CJ F.

description:
I have been for quite sometime now, a big fan. Quick, easy and no attitude but with lots of flavor. This local restaurant in the Outer Mission has been our favorite lunch and carry out for dinner when we crave for good Thai food. It is not Chinese owned but owned by a very nice sister and brother combo.

Forget about these bad reviews from folks asking for superb customer service and giving this decent place a one star. Yes, if you are having a bad day, don't blame the restaurant!!!!! If you want 5 star service then go to Farina, or Fleur de Lys, or Boulevard. This is a small family owned business and since there is only a few extra hands you should come prepared to wait a little while. You are paying for the food, reasonably priced, and they are tasteful and very authentic.

Time to support your local restaurants! Come in and try. Or better yet, call in advance and pick it up.
author: Ernesto T.

description: Great food. Very authentic. Not crazily spicy... Owner is very welcoming. We strongly recommend!
author: Ayelet G.

description: Delicious!  Lovely tender beef salad, coconut shrimp soup with lemon grass , and  finally screaming shrimp and chicken Pad Thai.  Definitely warrants repeated return visits.
author: Lindsay H.

description: I'm going to start off by saying that I feel jipped by coming here.  I used yelp to find a good Thai place in the area I was in.  This has a 4 star rating so I gladly came in thinking it would be very good.  I'm very disappointed.  I ordered the shrimp pad thai.  The noodles were too soft/soggy.  I asked for spicy and it wasn't spicy at all.  Truthfully, this place reminded me of a fast food type of thai food.  One where you can't expect much from the taste or quality.  I also want to comment that I'm writing this review from my laptop because for some odd reason it doesn't let me leave a review through my phone app, pretty suspicious to me.  I've been trying for a few days now and each time I've tried leaving a 2 star review, it would freeze on me and I'd have to shut the app down to go back into yelp.  Oddly, I thought maybe it was the app, but no, I was able to review other places with no problem!  Anyway, if you're looking for a 4 star thai food place, this is not it, keep looking.
author: Yisel F.

description:
Absolutely no service.

When I asked about the confusing lunch special menu setup and tried to puzzle it out, the lone server said "You still don't understand?" in a tone that suggested I didn't understand English. And he proceeded to read the exact words off the menu with no additional verbal instructions. 

Well, I'm sorry I don't understand this poorly scripted menu, but that doesn't mean you have to treat me like a child, especially when there are no other customers in the restaurant? 

The food itself is especially horrible...an overwhelming amount of fish sauce and oil in everything--complete lack of care and taste. I wouldn't come here again if the pad thai were $1, thanks very much.
author: Baviera K.

description:
I had never been to this place despite my many trips to the Excelsior. So rather than hit sushi raw, I walked into this place even though it was completely empty for dinner.  

My friend said "Oh...It's freezing in here." One of the guys working there, perhaps the owner, shouted "That's because people like you leave the door open!"  And out the door we went. With a vibe that bad, why bother?
author: Gabriel D.

description:
Solid Thai restaurant.  I had the Panang Curry w/ beef and my girlfriend had the Mango Fried rice w/ prawns and pork.  She really liked her's and mine was alright, a bit soupier than I'm used to but I still enjoyed it.

It's a bit on the pricier side compared to other Thai restaurants I've been to and my Panang Curry didn't come w/ rice, I had to order it separately, but it was solid.  It was open on Sunday and a bit on the later side.
author: Vincent-Arthur B.

description:
Aside from the over rated thai resturants in the Sunset and the city that we all go to, I was looking for a authentic thai place around my neck of the wood. Living between the border of SF and DC near the mission, I searched YELP to find a decent thai restuarant around my area. I started to review various restuarant and ZABB caught my attention. 

There were various negative reviews and comments about their service and their taste of food. What really caught my attention is that Ben (the owner) replied to their comments which of course there is always to sides to a story, hence I went over to give it a try to give my HONEST opinion.

My lady and I went over this evening and ordered the following:

Pumpkin Curry with chicken
- Pumpkin-licious!!! A must order. Texture and taste was phonomenal!

Papaya Salad
- Excellent!!!!

Tom Yum Soup with Prawns
- The prawns were huge and VERY FRESH! Spice level was on par. 

Fresh GInger with beef over flat noodles (special order)
- Instead of ordering the normal Pad Kee Mao, I asked if they would make me a special order and without ANY hesitation, they obliged. This is what you call GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. IT was VERY TASTY and FULL of FLAVOR!!

I have travelled to Thailand numerous times and I can tell you that ZABB brought the taste to San Francisco. 

To those who thought the food was not tasty and service was not up to par, please give them another try. I had a wonderful dining experience and will definitely  e going back again. 

Oh yea, by the way, all that food with two beers and a bowl of rice and leftovers for the next few days set me back $53.00 including a 15% tip

Keep up the good work and see you soon ZABB!!
author: Scott L.

description:
***delivery order

I ordered...
Chicken Noodle Soup
Basil Fried Rice w/ Crab meat

Fried rice was a bit salty but still good. Chicken noodle soup was not so tasty.

Overall, it was okey.

Hey, the delivery was fast!
author: Rie S.

description:
I absolutely love this place! I work nearby so
I always come during lunch time and sometimes after work. The place is hardly ever packed when I'm there so there is good service. Food is very delicious and full of flavor. Generous portions as well. My fav dish is the chicken pad see ew but I have heard amazing things about the pumpkin curry. Price for the food is very reasonable as well. Most importantly, the restaurant itself is always very clean and I'm always sketch about any family owned restaurants in the mission. 5 stars! :)
author: Stacey B.

description:
It's reassuring to know that on particularly cold days in the Excelsior, this place is waiting to wrap you in a snuggly, comforting blanket of pumpkin curry and pad thai noodles. On hot days, their thai iced tea and papaya salad really hit the spot. 

I really like all the staff, as well. When I wanted to order their mango sticky rice and they were out of mango, they made a custom dessert with the fruit they had on hand, instead. It was delicious, and the cook who made it beamed when I told him they should offer it on the menu. Couldn't ask for a more wonderful, friendly experience.
author: Aaron Y.

description: It's a big plus that they deliver, but I found the food to be just passable.  I tried pumpkin curry with chicken and pad see ew with tofu.  Living nearby I will definitely try it again.
author: T-Bone L.

description: Flavorful,  fresh, and always perfectly seasoned.  We have ordered from here numerous times for take out but this was the first time we went in to eat the the restaurant.  There was no wait,  we sat right down.  The waitress was prompt,  sweet and attentive.  This is definitely a hidden  gem in the outer mission.  The prices are reasonable making Zaab Cuisine a great value.  The decor was nothing fancy but when you are completely zoned in on Spicy Eggplant with tofu who cares what is on the walls.
author: Stari N.

description: Went for a late lunch with the family yesterday and loved everything we ate. Quick, friendly service in a nice clean restaurant. The fried papaya was very yummy. Asked for a cup of tom ka gai and it was as good as any I've had. The pumpkin curry was yummy over the Jasmine rice. The guy working there entertained my 2 year old and for that I should give 5 stars, but I'll keep it realistic ;)
author: Amanda S.

description:
Great improvement since I ate their last (about 6 months ago). I ordered pumpkin curry, tom yum soup, and papaya sald with a side or rice. The portions were big, the delivery was fast and the food was great!

Good job Zabb
author: Shaina T.

description:
I usually order by phone and pick up since I live so close. Their soup is great, I usually get the hot and sour soup with prawns. My other favorite dishes are the pumpkin curry, their pad Thai, and the papaya salad.  

Oh, and to Gabriel D: this is a food review site, not a 'vibe' review site. Their food is excellent, giving one star because you and yours left the door open is ridiculous. Don't bother going on yelp if you're going to act like a spoiled child.
author: D M.

description: Best tasting Thai food in San Francisco! This modest-appearing restaurant is so tasty. Lunch specials are a great deal. The fried tofu is similar to the Taiwanese stinky tofu (just not stinky). Spicy basil with pork is a must have, but every dish can be made vegetarian. Each dish is filled with intense flavor. I recommend the green iced tea, too.
author: Francesca C.

description:
I love Zabb Thai! I have been in the neighborhood for five months and the folks at Zabb have always made my food so delicious and the delivery is quick as can be ( I am seven blocks away).
Some of my favorites items on the menu are the thai samosas (crunchy, filling and you cannot go wrong with the peanut sauce), green curry (one of my besties' fave), the pumpkin curry is divine and so comforting on a wet night like tonight, and the coconut fried rice seems decadent because it is, but it matched so well with the curries you have to get it :). My only wish is that the manila mango was accessible all year round because I could eat their mango and sticky rice all day :D
Give them a chance and stop in their restaurant. Stay local!!!!!!
author: Betsey L.

description: Food was good.  Friendly staff.  Will definitely come back . . . Oh, just one thing, hard to find parking.  But otherwise, perfect dinner.
author: Mirasol S.

description: This place is awesome and delicious. Super relaxing, great food! You go to this place for the awesome gold prawns, the samosas, or any of the curries!
author: Rose K.

description:
In honor of my newly-gained "regular" status (don't be jealous, I put in the time), I would like to say a few more things about this place. I've gone through a good portion of the menu by now, and I've yet to have a bad meal. 

Quality is consistent, flavors are flavorful, service is friendly, and the prices are reasonable. 

Upvotes for papaya salad, chef noodle, beef pad kee mao, and red curry.
author: Will R.

description:
I live in Mission Terrace, halfway between Zabb Cuisine in the Excelsior and Osha Thai in Glen Park.  The choice is always easy for me. Zabb's food is lighter and less oily. You can taste the fresh vegetables and they are not weighed down by the sauce. The owners are always friendly and the atmosphere is warm and pleasant.

I especially like their version of the Panang Curry.  I have kids and they like the more conventional yellow curry.

I guess I feel like with Osha people confuse stylish waiters and furniture with good food.  With Zabb you get the genuine article.
author: Scott O.

description: This place is okay, no other Thai restaurants in the area. The food is decent, in my opinion some menu items are better than others. I wish I could give them a higher rating, but I'm not usually in the area so I can get better Thai food elsewhere. The interior space is beautiful, by far one of the cleanest restaurants in that area. Super friendly service, one time they even let me order a lunch item during dinner.
author: Luis C.

description: Great choice for lunch. $7 gets you a sizable amount of food. I ordered the yellow curry and to my surprise it came with a small salad, pad thai and rice. That's a great lunch deal. If you're in the neighborhood you should stop by. Great place for lunch.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I was driving down Mission street searching for a new place to try and I came across Zabb since my dining companion didn't want pupusas again.  (I can't help if I love them!)  The servers were extremely nice and welcoming and initially sat us near the door, but since I pointed out that I was freezing they let me choose my seating in a blocked off area.  Thank you.  

We split the spring rolls, chicken satay, green papaya salad, and pad thai with veggies.  The spring rolls were typical deep fried goodies.  Anything deep fried is essential in my book.  The peanut sauce that came with the chicken satay was thick and creamy like chunky PB (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/KLUiOz5L75XeDf_Kaltjxw?select=DqicP4URLEfZVzJTEMLtTg).  It was delicious and I smothered the leftovers on my pad Thai.  I expected the veggies in my pad Thai to be bean sprouts and shredded carrots, but no.  The vegetables were large broccoli florets and carrots, mushrooms, tofu, etc.  It was quite substantial and very tasty.  Not the best pad in the world Thai, but very good nonetheless.  I could stop eating it.  

What stood out to me, and gets its own paragraph, was the papaya salad.  I always compare papaya salad to Keo's in Honolulu.  This papaya salad was probably the best I've ever had.  It's small, but full of flavor.  And the presentation is beautiful (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/KLUiOz5L75XeDf_Kaltjxw?select=NvWVm0LX-JHNeuXPHTHSHQ).  The green beans and tomatoes in it were unexpected, but a pleasant surprise.  The lime dressing was amazing and perfectly tart.  My companion didn't want this dish, but we ended up fighting over it and I wanted to yell at him, "I ORDERED THIS, GET YOUR OWN!"  We were sharing so I refrained myself, but glared at him every time he went in for more.  Since Zabb is in my neighborhood I will go back for this dish if nothing else.
author: Justine D.

description: After eating here for almost 1.5 years I am finally writing a review about my go to Thai restaurant. I was first introduced to Zabb by my boyfriend. He suggested that I try this place out since he eats there quite often during his lunch. I wasn't disappointed at all. The first time I recall ordering the 2 item lunch special. They used to have the option of having pad Thai with the lunch special but they have removed that option for a while. They also stopped serving the 2 item lunch special on the weekends, which kinda sucks because I don't really eat much so I usually opt for small portions. I have tried many items from their menu such as the pad see ew, pad kee Mao, pad Thai, duck noodle soup (my favorite thing on the menu but a bit oily), the lucky bags appetizers, chicken satay skewers (meat is pretty moist), papaya salad (one of my other favorites), basil beef, larb, the green curry and lastly the Thai GREEN tea (one of my favorite drinks but they sure put a lot of ice) . Everything I've tried there is really good in my opinion. I would definitely recommend this Thai place to my friends. However, I feel like it's so unknown and underrated due to the location of this restaurant. It's not really in the heart of mission so people usually just walk by without knowing about this gem. Hopefully business continues to grow for this place!
author: Cori N.

description:
This place is ok . We ordered the following:

Green Thai Iced Tea: It is good and not very sweet, which I like. 

Hot and Sour soup: it tasted good and not too spicy.

Pineapple fried rice: just ok. After the soup, I had high expectation for this dish, but just ended up being mediocre.

Pad See Ew: just ok. I have had better at other restaurants at SF downtown and Sunset areas.

I will definitely come back for the Green Thai Iced tea and try their curries.
author: Winny W.

description:
Honestly, this is my favorite Thai Restaurant out here in SF!!!

Such a HIDDEN GEM!! 

Their Pad Thai and Spicy Eggplant Basil are sooooooooooo goooooooooood. You can really taste the freshness and the kicks of all the ingredients!! 

Service here is always welcoming, friendly, and fast! They really accommodate your needs!

This place deserves 5 star ratings. 

The only thing that sucks is parking but hey, we're in SF -- what's new with that? 

DEFINITELY worth going to and not pricey at all! 

The atmosphere is pretty calm and chill -- I like going here to catch up with friends and eat great food
author: Elisa L.

description:
Zabb is the same family that used to own Yamo Thai Kitchen at 18th and Mission st. Zabb is SIMPLY the BEST THAI food in san francisco and the ONLY THAI for me, as i am completely spoiled by their cooking.
