I usually judge a restaurant by their pad thai, red veggie curry, thom Ka soup, and their pad ma keur. All at Zabb are PERFECT! 

It is the best in the city without the attitude and high prices.

Thank GOD they are back!!!
I don't care how long the mission bus takes to get me down there, if I'm in the mood for Thai, it has to be Zabb!
author: stephen d.

description:
You need to expand!!!

Friendly staff, plenty of seating, and really tasty food!  My hubby and I end up here for lunch mainly when we're getting our eyes checked in the neighborhood, but at times I'm tempted to make the trip.  Why is good Thai food so hard to find?

Tasty tasty:
*Spicy eggplant with beef
*Chicken pad see ew
*Coconut milk soup with tofu

CHEAP, FRIENDLY, AND TASTY THAI!
author: Christine K.

description: Fast service, REALLY great flavoring with lots of very fresh tasting fresh herbs and spices.  Curries with fried tofu are always my favorite at Thai places and the red curry did not disappoint!
author: Daisy A.

description:
Every time my girlfriend and I have come here for dinner we are never disappointed. It's not usually a busy crowd, which is sad because it's so good! More people need to know about it if they live near the excelsior so it can continue! 

The servers and cooks are super friendly. The prices are reasonable for the portions you get. We always start off with a green papaya salad, which they serve in this cute edible bowl made of crispy dough and topped with yummy sauce and peanut bits. It's super refreshing and good appetizer to share on a date. My favorite dish is the curry noodle, because it's a combo of the two main plate options: curry with rice, or a noodle plate. Best of both worlds, just thinking about it again is making my mouth water. All of it's good, though. My girlfriend got the pumpkin curry which was really tasty, and you get to choose the meat, prawns, or tofu for all the dishes. 

For dessert, the fried banana ice cream is so delicious! 

If you are in the excelsior, give this place some love. It will love you back :)
author: Katie D.

description: We had the spicy eggplants and spicy basil crispy chicken for takeout. It was delicious. So glad to have this place in the neighborhood.
author: Darren L.

description:
This place had great promise!  We really wanted to order from them and were planning on ordering big (6 people)!  Their yelp profile says they deliver and they accept credit cards.  When I called I gave my address and they said they didn't deliver 1 mile away.  The girl who sounded like she could have been 14 (which is illegal) couldn't quite explain to me the exact reason why they didn't deliver a mile away. 
14 year old girl:  That's too far!
Me:  A mile away is too far?
14 year old girl:  Yeah its too far.  
Me:  So you guys don't deliver a mile away?  

I thought to myself how far do you deliver?  She couldn't explain and so then I guess her boss/maybe dad got on the phone and said he doesn't deliver that far.
Me:  On your yelp profile it says you deliver and you accept credit cards. 

We actually almost considered ordering it to pick up in which case they accept credit cards.  I said you know what don't worry about it.  I explained the situation to the fan and so my wife wanted to take a stab at it.  We thought that there was a language barrier with my phone call.  To shorten this up a bit the wife called and mentioned some of the key points I made not revealing she was calling from the same household.  Boss/dad:  I don't care what yelp says.

Oh really you don't care?  Well I don't care what you have to offer.  I didn't realize that they had such a great client base that they are willing to be so rude and turn away new business.  I would be afraid if you got an attitude with them and still decided to order form them they might do something to the food.  I would avoid place like the plague.  Unless you like rude people!  I will never order from this place!
author: Anthony C.

description:
Had take out here on a Friday night:

Papaya salad - a little tart, but good. Beautiful display

Beef pumpkin curry - yum! Would come back for this dish!!

Chicken pad Thai - not the best I've had, but hard to have to-go Pad Thai taste excellent. 

Overall, good flavors, good value.Glad to have this restaurant in the Excelsior!
author: Fanny L.

description: Don't be fooled by the location and exterior: this restaurant might not look the classiest, but the food is far more delicious than one might be led to believe. I came here for a birthday dinner with my family after looking through the Yelp reviews and although we were hesitant at first, everyone ended up really pleased with the quality and taste of the food (be warned though most of it is really spicy). The green Thai iced tea in particular is not something to miss out on. It's not the fanciest of places, obviously, but I recommend it if you're looking for yummy Thai food.
author: Rebecca R.

description: Zabb is an undiscovered gem in the Excelsior - my favorite neighborhood cafe.  I've never experienced the poor service others mention and I think it is excellent Thai food.
author: LaVonne J.

description:
A fine place to stop in for a quick lunch... which is all I've done here so far. The pad thai had plenty of vegetables, and wasn't too heavy/greasy.  Pretty standard.

It is a pretty big place, so would probably accommodate groups pretty easily.  The staff was friendly and quick (as they should have been since I was one of two customers there).

I'm not sure I'll have a chance to go for dinner or try something more exciting, but I would if I did.
author: Amy S.

description:
Pretty good food for a reasonable price, I was thrilled to find Thai food that would actually deliver to me!

also, even though I didn't have enough to tip the man as well as I would have liked, he was very nice and very polite.

Veggie sprong rolls are bomb, i loved the pumpkin curry(tell them to put extra basil) and my boyfriend snarfled his phad see yew right up, so that also must have been great!
author: Jasmine F.

description: I live a block away and had not tried this place in the 1.5 years I have been living here. I usually stay away from a regularly empty place but today when walking by I ignored the empty feeling and went inside. I ordered the shrimp Pad Thai to go and I am very satisfied with this dish. So I will be back again.
author: Tony M.

description:
Super nice ppl and nice environment inside although outside is ugly near bus stop and lots of graffiti on the walls. Food is fantastic for the price. Not my fave Thai food but decent for the area (Excelsior) which sorely lacks any good dining.

Fantastic lunch deal here. Two items for 6.99.
author: Sharif R.

description:
I tried this place a while ago.. Curry's good but not over the hill good. I did come here for lunch and it was close enough to work. 

If anyone works around the Excelsior district, and would like to eat Thai, try this place.
author: Eudora Z.

description:
I used to lived in the Excelsior and a thai restaurant was opened, i think, about one year ago, so i decided to give it a try.  One day afternoon i wanted to "high tea" around my house. I wanted to try something new and i went to this thai place. Okay, the restaurant was empty but i understand because it is not lunch hours or any busy time. We both order the lunch special, it comes with entree, rice, pad thai, and salad. I didn't remember what we ordered but they were okay. 

Then i went there a few times after that and i guess they were all okay. BUT I AGREE WITH ALL THE YELPERS THAT COMMENTED ON THIS RESTAURANT, THEIR PAD THAI SUCKS ****.
  
I never hate it. Not until today. I was so glad that i havent wrote a review until today. Everything changes until today.

It is actually a short story, so i will start.

It was a great evening and i just wanted some thai iced tea. I went with my friend. She only had credit and debit cards on her, so this is the conversation:

my friend: what is the minimum charge for credit card?

mean old waitress: 10 dollars

my friend: oh ok. So it wont work if i only want thai iced tea?

mow: NO YOU CANT.

 then we were looking for cash in her bag and wallet. there was only a dollar in the wallet but it was her special dollar with some kind of special meaning. So we were like i guess we couldnt get anything.
ME: we dont have any cash.

mow(semi- whispering): I just saw you have money, you just dont want to buy it.

SO YOU HAVE BEEN STARING AT ME THE WHOLE TIME!!! MY FRIEND SAID SHE FELT LIKE SOMEONE HAD BEEN SPYING ON HER WALLET.

ME: BUT WE REALLY DONT HAVE ANY MONEY AND SHE ONLY HAS A DOLLAR.  whispering: Just leave.

we were about to get up and she said again

mow: If you dont want it, then i guess next time.

me thinking: Oh okay lady, i will never be back ever again even if i have been starving for days and about to die of starvation and dehydration.
There wont be a next time for you.

My final thought: Food is okay. The waiter before was so much nicer than this " thing".  This was the worst service i have ever had in my experience of costumer service. I feel like i was being watched  the whole time in that freaking restaurant.  Waitress is extremely mean. Cant believe they still let her to be the waitress, i hope she will get changed after this review, maybe not, but this will be a good opinion to consider thinking about it. Oh yea, and they were talking about us in thai while we were still in the restaurant. i guess they dont know what  respect is.  I think this place doesnt deserve any star but the one star is for their food and the nice waiter before.  

I DONT RECOMMEND IT . DONT EVER GO THERE.
author: Lily L.

description:
I've eaten in a lot of thai restaurants, but for a local restaurant in our neighborhood...this is ok.  The food is good and plentiful.  I've had the yellow curry chicken with rice, and other dishes which fail me right now.  I would recommend this for local dining and good food.

If you like Cilantro, you'll enjoy this place.  The food has a different and wonderful flavor.  The Thai Fried Rice is very tasty!  Come and try it out to sit in or take out.  The place is clean and has a great ambiance.
author: O ..

description: Good food. Awful service. They need to take some waiting table classes.
author: Maribel B.

description:
I ordered red curry extra spicy, and a Thai tea. Tasty, no mystery ingredients here. Clean flavors, good quality.

+Service is friendly.
+Food is aesthetically pleasing and dished well.
+Portions are very appropriate, though "appropriate" sizes might seem like too small to people these days. The servings come with a side of pad thai and salad.
+Clean place.

They really are located in the wrong area, though. Clean places that serve decent food will always be welcome in places like Mission/Excelsior, but this place is also priced a little higher than most places in the neighborhood as well. Reasonable because it's higher quality, but there are other good places around here to eat at with lower prices and bigger portions, though not nearly as hygienic or use as good quality ingredients. And they aren't Thai. 
If this place was located anywhere else, it'd probably get a lot more business and be considered a better deal. So it's a trade-off, really. 

Worth trying, and to visit on occasion.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Yum! Yum! Yum! Yum! Yum!

Amazing food.  Friendly fast service.  Good Prices.  

Try the "Spicy Basil Crispy Chicken"  

It's nice to have some good food in my hood for once.
author: Kent S.

description: Zaab is amazing! My fiancé and I have frequented this restaurant for around two years now, since we first moved to San Francisco. We were home-sick and reminiscing about our favorite Thai restaurants back home, when we thankfully discovered Zaab. The pumpkin curry is super awesome, as is the pad thai. We've always been pleased with the service and the owner is incredibly friendly.  The price is affordable and the portions are huge. Definitely a great find!
author: Alicia V.

description: I have been coming here as a native San Franciscan for years now. I have tried so many Thai places in search of the perfect Thai Tea. Well I must say, this place has the perfect balance of tea to cream ratio. It may sound crazy but I do not like it when places mix the tea before serving. I love the presentation when the ice, tea, and cream is separated so perfectly. When going to other Thai restaurants they look at me as if I were insane for asking them to not mix the tea and leave it separated. It makes all the difference on your pallet when drinking it in! Besides their perfect Thai Tea, their curries are out of this world! I love to get the curry noodles with your choice of meats, poultry or seafood. I get it with prawns and crab. It's heavenly! Also the Satay is so tender and the condiments that come with it, amazing and so fresh. There presentation is impeccable for being a local neighborhood spot. And I must add that their kitchen is spotless and the bathroom. (Which I always check before ordering) I will keep coming back and recommend this place to anyone who wants a reasonable, authentic and delicious meal. You will walk out satisfied and full!
author: Jeanine C.

description:
Years ago, Betelnut used to serve a spicy rice noodle with beef and egg dish which we loved. It went off the menu not long after we discovered it. 

We found a similar dish at Zabb last friday. It was SPICY and DELICIOUS! Even better, it costs only $7 while at Betelnut, it costs close to three times of that.

We also had pumpkin curry (with chicken), green curry(with Prawn), and Spicy Basil with pork.  Everything was good.  We also tried a Thai Sake called "Zato", which was smooth and easy-drinking.

We've walked pass this restaurant multiple times before and didn't realize it was a Thai restaurant till i saw it mentioned in Yelp.  Yelp is great! :)

As with all the other reviewers, i sure hope this excellent restaurant will survive. I know we will be doing our share to eat here whenever we could.
author: Jean Z.

description: Decent Thai. Decent price but not exceptional food.   Served slivered lime slices in the water, when I asked for more the waiter complained they were too expensive. I told him I would give him an extra dollar to cover the tap water taste. He never brought more. We did try the pumpkin curry, good but not great. Seems more like a Thai diner.
author: Lori H.

description: They have great pad thai and tasty lemon ice tea!
author: Jacob H.

description:
I stay on Mission and Excelsior every time I visit the city. Lately, I'm in a very happy place in my life where all I wanna eat is curry. I had actually never checked out this restaurant because all my parents like to eat is rice, beans and pupusas (beaners), but one day I made my dad buy me curry. 

OH GOD. It was excellent. I'm from Miami and most Thai restaurants there serve their curry for about fifteen bucks a plate. NOW IF YOU KEEP UP WITH MY REVIEWS (who am I kidding? No 1 keeps up with my reviews. :( ) I have a soft spot for quality food that won't drill holes in your pocket. This is it. 

Ten bucks will get you curry or pad Thai, and some Thai tea!
author: Gema O.

description: I'm so glad that it's just right in the corner on our street, the food's are awesome! The owners are so great, service all in all is wonderful ;)
author: Cielo Lyn L.

description: Slow service, and it's more of a take out place than dine in. The food was ok, but not great. Staff did not seem concerned about us having a good dining experience. Save your money and time, drive out of the neighborhood and head to king of thai noodle.
author: Pamela N.

description:
Best Thai Food I've had in SF.  

Along with my friends, all I could say was, "This is so good!!" over and over and over, until we were stuffed. The staff is very friendly and the food is so gooood. 

Try the green curry. Far superior than King of Thai & Best of Thai. Sorry guys, but this place is Fantastic!

*Reviewed by my sister. 

I suggest going right now.
author: Em L.

description:
Nice service and decor, food that's vibrant, tasty, and somehow homey and real-tasting, yet attractively presented. Reasonable, typical prices. The only Thai in the Excelsior. So why it so often empty? My lame guess is that the prices are about $.50 higher than suits the neighborhood. 

While not "destination dining," this is a restaurant that is doing everything right and yet gets less love than it deserves. 

Go in, y'all, even if it's not busy. It's yummy, quality food. They are never understaffed and you can read below how nice the service is.
author: John H.

description:
Okay, so my first experience was bad but I came here a few times again with my coworkers and its better now.

They offer a lunch special for I believe less than $7 or $8 where you can chose different type of curry and they serve you a small portion of pad thai, curry, salad and rice.  Besides the first time I went, my experience have been good.  It's not bad for the lunch special.  You might think the portions are small but it's pretty filling at the end.  

I like how there's different types of curry you can pick with your choice of meat and along with that you get the pad thai too.  It's like you're kind of sampling it rather than committing to eating one whole dish.  I also tried their chicken noodle soup here which wasn't too bad but I wasn't too impress either. 

The service is definitely very friendly and each time I have went they are very attentive and constantly refilling your water.
author: Mabel C.

description:
You ever had awful Thai? We all have. There's crap Thai on every corner in every neighborhood...

This place is a total surprise. It's clean. It's good. It's cheap. 

The cashew chicken is simple and great. The pad Thai, while not perfect, is fresh. They don't over cook their prawns (like every other restaurant in the world). And, they are extremely friendly and helpful.

We live a few blocks away, and they deliver within about 25 minutes. Which means that the foods not soggy and old, by the time it arrives at your door.
author: Rich H.

description:
Where else can you get a good, tasty, filling plate lunch for $6.99? Right here at Zabb Cuisine!  There are a number of dishes to choose from and come with Pad Thai, jasmine rice, and salad.

This may not be the best ever Thai restaurant in town as I haven't tried them all but I certainly appreciate how clean this place is -- no greasy tablecloths or oily/smoky smells lingering in the air or clinging to everything.  The food tastes fresh -- not like it's been sitting around pre-cooked on some burner.

The family that runs it is very friendly and helpful.
author: Mac C.

description:
Such a great find! We wish we had stumbled upon Zabb sooner... We enjoy eating in the restaurant and recently ordered for delivery (which ended up being faster than anyone else around).

Some of our faves include the Thai samosas, papaya salad, green curry avocado, and sweet & sour chicken (which is more like a sweet and sour barbecue style).

My husband also tells me they have awesome, affordable lunch specials... so I hope to try them for lunch sometime soon.
author: Lori H.

description: So happy to see that the Excelsior district is finally getting some good food options.  Prices are quite reasonable.  The Spicy Basil Crispy Chicken is a stand-out.  All the dishes have fresh ingredients.  Will come back again to sample other dishes.
author: Funk G.

description:
This place is right around the corner of my house and I love Thai Food. I've called in for take out twice. The first time spicy basil chicken over rice was good but forgettable. 

Today for lunch: I called in for take out - Pad Kee Mao 

The second I opened the take out box, the appearance of this dish i've ordered a million times at various Thai restaurants was so unfamiliar. 

Negatives: 

- The noodle they used was much wider than the norm. 
- The color of the dish clearly showed they used way too much tomato (tomato sauce). 
- TOTALLY lacking flavor
- This dish is suppose to have a kick from the Chili, NO SPICE whatsoever. 
- Tasted almost like a chinese Tomato Beef Chow Mein.......

So unexpected and disappointed. After reading all the other reviews, I wanted to support a local small business. But the taste/quality is just not up to par. 

Positive: 

- Big portion (compared to the spicy basil chicken, don't know why) 
- Lunch special is a dollar less than the dinner menu. 


:(
author: Michelle Y.

description: Never had Thai food before and I have fallen in love due to their pineapple chicken rice at this restaurant. I actually crave this dish at least once a week and I go so often I think they recognize me. I gave four stars for decor and because I have not had any other dish from here. I did try a sip of their pumpkin curry soup, but I don't want to base my review on that because I did not like it but I think it is because I have never had curry and I think thats what made the flavor off to me and feel those who do eat curry and eat it often would have a better educated opinion on it. Also, people I've gone with do seem to love their pumpkin curry soup.
author: Leigh H.

description: We really wanted to try this place. The reviews made it look good. According to their yelp profile they deliver and they accept credit cards but when I called first they said they didn't deliver a mile away!  What is your delivery policy?  "It's cash only for delivery as well" so you do accept credit cards or you don't.  I thought there was a language barrier with what sounded like a fourteen year old and then a guy.  So my wife called after me shortly once I was told that they didn't deliver a mile away. When my wife called he responded with a "I don't care what yelp says". Well buddy I don't care what you have to offer!  I would avoid this place like the plague if they are going to talk to their customers like that. Rude and false advertising!  I would be afraid they might do something to the food if they got upset with you.  What a shame!  We planned on ordering for a family of 6.  They must have enough business that they can be cheeky to new customers that they don't need them.
author: Anthony C.

description:
I loved this place up until my bf went in to grab thai tea to go.  He asked for thai tea and it was $2.20 but he noticed the lady put so much ice so he asked for no ice and the guy said he charges extra .50 which is STUPID.. come on.. 50 cents extra if you dont want ice.. ive never heard that before..

other than that ,they have ONE thing I LOVE! its their specialty (i think!)
Spicy CRISPY CHICKEN basil. SOOOOOO GOOD!! 
their pad thai is alright
and their thai tea is ok
its that damn spicy Crispy Chicken basil that keeps me coming back


Their fried banana and ice cream isn't bad either.  The downside is that they only give one small banana with one small scoop of ice cream.  If you're on a date, and its your "thing" to always have dessert, make sure you buy 2. one for you and one for your friend.
author: anna l.

description:
Last Time I ordered for delivery

The delivery guy (the owner I think) called me saying I gave him the wrong address- he was kind of mean- I'm shrugging it off as a communication issue - but he kept saying "you gave me this address" (i did not)- blame it on esl I guess (communication?  )
the food wasn't as good as it was the first few times I tried it- no spice whatesoever in the curry and the hot soup I ordered- I suspect they are catering to us gringas- come on it's the excelsior- I want spice!!!!
Will try them again- cheaper and better food than osha- man guess I have to have my thai friends order for me so I can get some flavor!!!!
author: Karen H.

description:
I wanted to like this place... I really did... it was close by to my place... and it would of solved my Thai cravings without having to drive too far.... However, the experience my husband and I had there was horrible. It started off nicely, the thai tea wasn't bad, and the soup we had was pretty tasty and sour. 

Then came the angel wings (they were chicken wings stuffed with silver noodles inside). The presentation of the wings were nice... and then I took a bite out of the chicken wing. and notice it was cold and pink inside. Then I realized the chicken was still frozen and raw inside but brown and fried on the inside. 

So we sent back the wings and got a new batch. (
Then came the pad thai, it was not good at all..

And after all that, we paid too much for raw, frozen, odd tasting food. 

I will sadly not be returning to this establishment.
author: J V.

description:
The place is clean, spacious, and the staff's pretty attentive.  

But....the food's just not that great and the portions were pretty small.

I won't be coming back.
author: Pinkyton C.

description:
I would actually rate this place 3.5 Stars.  

Food is 3 stars and Service is 4 stars

I work down the street from this place and dine here frequently.

Now that I'm trying to get back into the yelp of things again.  Im writing this review.

The food here is good.  Not the greatest Thai food and certainly not the worst.  What makes this place great is the services that the owners give.  They are top notch.

I would definitely recomment this place if you are in the area.
author: Tony Y.

description:
Too bad you cannot give half a star because the unpleasant surprise in my food deserves a call to shut them down.

So I ordered for take out from here because it is the closest Thai restaurant to my house. The Thai tea was yummy and large, not over-filled with ice compared to many other restaurants. 

I would say if you want to stay and dine, it does look like a friendly atmosphere with parking available and the 14, 49 bus stops right in front. 

HOWEVER, this is where I would give no stars to, the pad thai was TERRIBLE. I ordered it with shrimp and they were not close to fresh. It tasted old and rotten. To complete the lack of sauce and seasoning, the noodles were over-cooked and I ate something that tasted like pieces of paint. I had to spit it out and did not finish the noodles. Literally, there were pieces of paint-like particles that I nearly choked on. DISGUSTING~ worst pad thai ever!!!!!!!


My boyfriend's entree was better, but not by much. Really need to balance things out better with the right ratio.
Perhaps other items on the menu taste better but I give up on the restaurant. Any time when you taste something foreign in a simple dish, not worth saving the time because I rather drive further to get better food.
author: Thia T.

description:
Not the best Thai food I've ever had, but the customer service here was really good, and the interior is really comforting. The waiter (owner?) is very friendly. I've been in here three times, and this time, they seem to have expanded their menu, which is a good thing. It's usually dead in here every time I go. 
I've had the Chili Basil Chicken and Pad Kii Mao, but they aren't as tasty as other places. The sauce on the Pad Kii Mao isn't as good, and tastes kinda like ketchup mixed with chili. There seems to be a lack in 'authenticity' of their Southeast Asian dishes, and reminds me of an American-fusion place. The Fried Banana with Ice Cream was a disappointment too, as the bananas were deep fried a little too much, and more on the crunchy side.
There's not a lot of prominent Thai restaurant in the Excelsior, so I think this place is worth going to. It's very decent!
author: Evar S.

description: Delicious thai food. Prompt delivery. We ordered the phad si ew & pumpkin curry- both were very very tasty!
author: Lea G.

description:
I decided to give this place a shit since I'm a sucker for Thai food. It was empty around 5pm on a Wednesday. I noticed the place was decorated with an elephant theme. Boy, do we Asians looove our elephants!! 

The service was decent being as I along with my guest were the only people there. We ordered Crispy Chicken Basil and Pad Thai. Prices were pretty standard for most Thai places ranging from $8-10 a dish. 

Crispy Chickem Basil: CAUTION! Can be super addicting and leave you salivating for more and more until you have finally reached hypernatremia due to your high intake of sodium. It's crispy just the way I like it with just the right amount of flavor. Not too overwhelming.

Pad Thai: not bad, but not great either. They use a thinner noodle than other Thai places, but nonetheless it was decent. They put slices of  carrots in it after it was cooked. I found this to be rather odd.

Note: the brown rice could have been better. A LOT BETTER. It was very chunky. I don't think it's suppose to be chunky. 

I would come back here just to try other dishes and to fulfill my cravings for the crispy basil chicken. mmm...
author: Sandra P.

description: Great food,Great service.Awesome atmosphere.......damn good prices!!!!!
author: RL M.

description: Okay Zabb. I've been a fan for 3 years, but Sunday was not a good experience. Call me back. Your options are: refund me, credit me, or lose me. It's up to you. Please use fresh ingredients is all I can suggest you serve.
author: Shop Sea Levels N.

description:
I tried.  Again moving to the Mission area, I HAVE to find a good place for food!  Came on a weekday for lunch.  Place was eerily quiet.  

I'm gonna make this quick and short.

We ordered three dishes:
Yellow Curry w/ Chicken - yuck
Ground chicken w/ basil and other veggies - there was no ground chicken, it was slices of chicken and didn't taste basil at all.
Crab fried rice - crab was minimal and corn and bellpeppers were oddly stirfried in.  ODD.

So no thank you Zabb.  I won't be coming back.  Too bad I love thai :(
I'd rather drive out to Marnee or Osha.. worth the traffic!
author: Alice E.

description: The food was delicious, fresh and fast. The coconut soup soup was amazing, so was the crispy tofu and pad Thai. Good thai ices tea aswell. The atmosphere was a bit drab, the place was empty and there wasn't much going on but  eating. The hand painted stencils were a nice touch. Definitely worth trying!
author: Nadine K.

description:
Nearly 100 Thai restaurants visited, and this is the only one that I can recall being attended to by a white guy.  

Zabb apparently replaced a more shabby looking Vietnamese joint.  The space is now a lot cleaner, more spacious, and--unless there's still a video poker machine in the back--less shady.  

Big portions are served up, but the food was mediocre.  The pra ram/peanut sauce had a strange resemblance to that from Best of Thai in the Haight (how I remember these things, I don't know).  My friend wasn't very fond of his beef noodle dish.  But the service is nice enough.  I'm sure I'd patronize more often if I lived in the area.  Thai is few and far between around these parts.  

Note:  Cash Only
author: Marsha Z.

description:
ive dined here recently after moving to the neighborhood. 
it wasnt that great. 
i should have known better since there is never any customers there. 
how can thai food be bland? i dunno but they sure do. 
they were also small portions.
but i wanted to give them another chance so i gave them a call
they advertise they deliver and i was feeling lazy and didnt want to go out
they guy answers the phone asks for my address of which i give him. 
he says he doesnt deliver to me, that its too far. 
i am 1.1 miles according to google, on a quiet neighborhood street with plenty parking. 
oh well.
author: Michael C.

description:
I try not the be that person who always orders the same thing when I go to a thai restaurant, but dammit, if there's a more perfect meal than yellow curry and rice ended off with a fresh plate of mango sticky rice, I haven't tried it.  

I ordered these exact dishes for delivery the other day along with some Tam Kah Gai and some kind of beef noodle dish for the ball and chain, and it was exactly how I wanted it, when I wanted it. The boyfriend said his noodle dish, which was supposed to be spicy, lacked any spiciness at all, though it was flavorful. I took a bite and would have to agree, hence the 4 stars. Otherwise, my curry was creamy goodness and my mango sticky rice hit all the right spots on my satisfaction meter. 

Being that it's the only thai restaurant I'm aware of in the neighborhood AND it delivers, this place deserves all the love it can get to keep it around. Do something different tonight Excelsiorites and cancel that pizza or Chinese order. Try some Thai.
author: Kat E.

description: I go to this Thai restaurant when I am in town because the food is relatively light and generally not too oily or salty. Spicy eggplant and fresh ginger with meat are excellent entrees with fragrant aromatics, while Pad Kee Mao is decent but done better at other Thai places because the sauce is too reminiscent of ketchup. I love their curries (green) even though the spiciness level is beyond my threshold. They tend to use a lot of onion and green onion in many entrees, yet they do not have that tasty stir fry taste. Somebody else said that the fried banana was just ok. Portion sizes are not that large, but the prices are reasonable. Service is courteous.
author: B H.

description: Decent Thai food.  I had the panang curry, which was pretty good, but not spicy enough for me.  But, I got it with shrimp and they were super generous (not just a couple, but tons of shrimp!), which I appreciate.  They also were super nice to my cousin's 3 year old daughter who made an absolute mess at the table.  Yay for nice, kid-friendly folks!
author: Cassidy P.

description:
I remember this place when it first opened, had lunch there once and have yet to go back until today. My co-worker and I ate lunch here. When both our plates arrived, one was significantly darker in the orange/red hue than the other. Weird considering we both ordered the same thing. Took one bite of my own and it was spicy, just the way I like it. Took one bite of my co-workers and it was bland. I almost felt like shoveling some of my pad that onto her plate in hopes of adding some flavor. There was a good mix of veggies and prawns and portion is big. But the inconsistency of flavoring is a disappointment. I mean they could have made both serving in one pan, right? 

Beautiful décor and pictures from Thailand are places on the walls. Wooden tables line the walls with a bench running along the wall for extra seating. The service was awesome, brought us water and kept filling every now and then. The owner? Checked in on us often. The prices are reasonable but they charge for tea.
author: Lola L.

description:
Thai close to my new home!  I'm sold on location and service but after the first visit, my vote on food will have to wait.  

We ordered my fave thai soup with coconut milk and it was delicious and surprisingly spicy.  I also ordered the pumpkin curry and forgot that red curry is the hottest curry out there.  I couldn't finish it.  Sad.  The soup had the right amount of heat but over the years my heat-o-meter has dipped and the pumpkin set me aflame.

When I return I'm going to sample more of their options and steer clear of the red-hots!

10/10/10:  Having returned here at least 5 times since our first couple visits, I am happy to report that not all items come spicy.  The menu seems larger than before and a recent take out order included a terrific pad thai and stuffed mushrooms.

Looking forward to many more quality visits.  I'd say this is one of 3 best restaurants in the Excelsior!  The other 2 are Sushi Raw and Mexico Tipico Taqueria.
author: Colleen C.

description: Best pad thai I ever had. Their other dishes are pretty darn good too, and pretty reasonably priced.
author: Matthew T.

description:
The best Thai restaurant in the neighborhood. I loved coming here when I was going through my Thai phase.

Nice, spacious restaurant. Lots of tables. If you sit in the front (party of 2), you can see people passing by on the street.

Nice, polite waiter.  Good customer service.  I even ordered delivery from them several times.  Minimum charge is $20 but they'll let you slide by a couple of dollars.

Their delivery boxes are not the regular-sized, square boxes. It's about 5"x7" and 2 inches deep - so you can visualize how little meat is in there especially when half of it are onions, carrots, bell peppers, etc.

I stopped going here after a friend pointed out how small the dishes are compared to other Thai restaurants.  I mean it's very delicious but sometimes a girl gotta get her grub on.
author: Joanna W.

description:
Great service and good food, but overall, it just ends up being average. Still, a decent Thai restaurant is a nice addition to the Excelsior district. It's worth coming to if you live around there, but if you're at ther side of the city, you'd probably find something better there.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
I came here with expectations, from a couple of friend's high recommendation; that in of itself is an automatic negative 1/2 star.  Not because I don't trust my friend's taste, on the contrary they've been the voraciously intrepid in their constant search for foodie finds.  Like most people, I mentally/emotionally empathize with their orgasmic gastronomical experience.  Who hasn't done this, right?

I wasn't really in the mood for appetizer but saw that they had calamari on the menu.  Calamari is my Achilles heel; gotta try it at any new restaurant.  Well, the batter was not greasy and had a pleasurable crunch to it.  Unfortunately, the actual calamari was not fresh and to make matters worse, the sauce was really subtle.  On most occasions, this would be a plus, not this time!  I was hoping the subtlety sweet and spicy had the same coating effect as the store bought thai sauce to hide the sub par calamari.  That's a full star knock right there!  So, without having eaten the entrees, Zabb is already 1 1/2 stars down.

*** Review incomplete **
author: Don B.

description:
Just wandering by, Zabb's is not what you'd expect.  From the outside and surrounding area, it's a bit frightening and prompts you to ask yourself if you should reconsider.  But, really, it's quite nice inside.  Its clean, artfully decorated, and the service is exceptional.    Our water was ALWAYS refilled, they checked on our rice reserves during dinner, and were very attentive and nice (although in a silent way; our waiter barely spoke).

We had the lucky bag appetizers (picked on name alone) and it was nicely executed; the sweet/spicy sauce was not overpowering and the little bags were perfect bit-sized balls of shrimp/pork/spices.  It was crispy without being greasy.

For dinner we had the avocado curry with chicken.  Interesting, huh?  It was a perfect blend of spicy (jalapeos) and creamy.   We also had the pad with beef; it was nothing to write home about, but still very good.  The veggies were not soggy or pre-frozen and the noodles were not overcooked or stuck together (where you have to cut your portion off the serving plate...that drives me nuts)

Although the food isn't necessarily the greatest, it's a wonderful addition to the neighborhood and the service was absolutely amazing.  The prices are more than reasonable and the portions are large...and you get 5 star service for cheap, quality food. 

(Oh, and another plus:  clean bathroom!)
author: Val K.

description:
Zabb's must be my favorite Thai food in the city! Even if I didn't live in the Excelsior, I would definitely travel to go here. Reasonably priced, generous portions, with outstanding staff, I am proud to call myself a regular at this restaurant. So much so that the owner knows my usual order: yellow curry as mild as I like it and Thai iced tea. The Praram is also superb, and everyone likes the Pad Thai. 

Going to Zabb's always makes me happy. Whether it's for a special occasion, or just having to go out to eat because no one wants to cook, Zabb's is the perfect treat. 

P.S. Try the Fried Banana and Icecream for dessert!
author: Malinda P.

description:
I was pretty excited to see there was a Thai spot in the neighborhood when this place opened.  When I found they could deliver to my house i was nothing short of ecstatic.  The guy who runs the place is incredibly nice, and the service is incredibly quick.  Both times we have ordered delivery it has taken just about 20 minutes for the food to be at my door!

Unfortunately, the food is just ok.  Honestly, some of the most forgettable thai food I've ever eaten.  It's better in the restaurant than when you get it delivered.  Also, the delivery packaging is pretty shoddy, I hate getting soggy, dripping containers brought to my house.  Seriously, what kind of service is that?  I love having to replate every item I ordered before I can eat it.
author: Adrian L.

description: I was a little disheartened by the 2 and 3-star reviews of this place, because my family's experience here was very satisfactory. We ordered 4 different appetizers: the calamari, the crispy tofu, the prawns in a sleeping bag (prawns wrapped in rice paper), and the fried papaya with plum sauce, and they were all very good. The fried papaya in particular was a very nice surprise. For entrees, we ordered the pad see eiw, chef's choice noodle, prawns on a skewer, and sweet and sour chicken. Everyone at my table loved their dish, and I certainly enjoyed my sweet and sour chicken. We topped our meal off with the fried banana and ice cream dessert, and it was perfect. I would go back to this restaurant in a heartbeat, and if you're in the neighborhood, I encourage you to check it out.
author: Meg P.

description: ok...I came here just for happy hour....more so for dessert...we wanted mango and sticky rice....we got that and to my surprise I saw DEEP FRIED ice cream....I couldn't resist....and it was wonderful...perfectly done...no oily after taste....it was yum! Plus they also have in stock "Thai Sake?"  it's so good...it sort of reminds me of Lao Lao (sticky sweet rice wine)  it is so good....I will come back just to order those two combinations....and maybe some food.....we will see...oh....I love how clean and spacious the place is....love it.....next I will try the food....one day....if I am craving deep fried ice cream and Thai sake...yum!
author: Poppy M.

description: Ordered delivery from here and was very pleased. The process was fast and simple. The Pad Kee Mao was delicious and spicy. I would not recommend the spring roll appetizer because it comes with 6 small pieces- not a great value for $5.99. Overall, I would definitely order from here again!
author: Julia W.

description:
Tonight was my first, of many anticipated visits to Zabb.  Like so many other fans of Thai food, I have my culinary barometers - those few dishes I absolutely must try in my early visits to a new establishment, in order to ascertain where it falls on my personal foodie Richter scale.  I managed two out of the three tonight, the third being Panang. 
Zabb's Tom Ka Kai was outstanding in every aspect: chock full of tender breast meat, straw mushrooms, plus token carrots and cabbage as well as including those chunks of inedibles that make the broth so tasty (galanga, ginger, bay, etc).  This soup alone is worth driving distance for.
I followed it by their mango fried rice.  Typically, I give the pineapple fried rice a go, but this looked wonderful, and more than measured up to their description of it. 
Next up: panang and red curries, but just on first impressions, I think this may be my new go-to Thai place.
Decor - minimal, but clean.  Staff - attentive and pleasant.  Ironically enough, my next review (for the Thai place I visited yesterday) scores off the chart marks in these two areas, but not for the food. 

Solid 4 stars for Zabb.
author: Theresa B.

description:
Pros
- cheap
- fast friendly service
- ambient decor
- generous quantities

Cons
-meat can be dry sometimes, like their chicken curries
- empty every time I go there
-quality isn't up to the standards of Marnee Thai or Osha Thai

Their pad thai is very flavorful and has a kick. The noodles come together with the bell peppers and other ingredients. The papaya salad is fresh and tasty. The curries are bland.
author: Angus H.

description: Ben and his wife are about the nicest people I've ever met! I order from them as much for the deliciousness of the food as to chat with ben or his wife, who are so kind and lovely. I almost always order their pad thai as its about the best in the city but the pumpkin curry and thai curry are both stellar too.
author: Pia C.

description: Thanks again for catering our company that pumpkin curry with chicken and coconut rice was delicious. The mix vegatables with pork was perfecty cook. I know it's hard to make food taste the same when you order a big amount, but the flavors were there and explosive for large order. Thank you chefs for your hard work and of course we will be seeing you again.
author: mrhustler h.

description: The customer service was great. The owner (just a guess) was really nice to my boyfriend and I, considering we were the only ones in the restaurants until some friends of hers that she hasn't seen in years came and coincidently decided to eat at her restaurant. The decor is very different. At most thai places, I order their fried rice with pineapple in it. It wasn't on the menu so I just picked one of their fried rice and asked her if I could get pineapple in it. But when I got what I ordered, it didn't look like what I usually eat. It smelled like chicken cup of noodle and the color of it too. It wasn't what I was expecting and I was starving at the same time so I was looking forward to my pineapple fried rice but I was disappointed. I would come here again to give them another shot because every experience is different and every meal is as well.
author: Jessica R.

description:
It was great to see this place open up on Mission St. Frankly, I liked the old grimy Vietnamese place, but never was able to convince too many people to join me in going there. Now inside it's hard to believe it's the same space because of the completeness of the makeover. Kitchen/counter/seating/restrooms - they're all in the same spots, but the feel is so drastically different... It's a wonderful change - feels very comfy and lends a nice atmosphere to the experience. 

The service is wonderful, friendly but not overwhelming. The bf's daughter had just returned from almost two years living in Thailand, and the waiter talked with us for a long time about Bangkok and surrounding areas, and even conversed a bit in Thai with her. 

The food was fresh, tasty, in nice-sized portions, and colorfully presented. We were served quickly and with no fuss or confusion. The only reason I give Zabb 3 stars and not 4 is that the food almost didn't seem Thai to me, the seasoning was milder than I'm used to. Even the bf's curry, which was ordered extra-spicy, just didn't have the "pow" of flavors I most crave about Thai food. 

Still, I would go back here in a flash. Great to have a nice place like this in the 'hood.
author: Michael M.

description:
This is a recently remodeled space which also used to be a Thai place. The decor is great and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The food is just average, I am sorry to say. I was really hoping for it to be outstanding but it doesn't measure up against other Thai places I've eaten. The Pad Thai was somewhat bland. It needed some more lime juice to bring the flavors out I think. On a previous visit I had the spice basil chicken. The "spicy" consisted of a single sliver of jalapeno and the chicken was lower-grade and kind of gristly.
I would give them two stars except that: 1) They are new - maybe only open two weeks; and 2) the decor and staff are top-notch. I think they are aiming to do a lot of carry-out business so the dishes are made to be rushed out. If they take their time and get their groove down in the kitchen, this could be  a great place.
author: Joe H.

description:
I love good Thai food and this place does it just right for me!   My husband has taken cooking lessons in Thailand and London and he agrees that the dishes are top quality.  We've had a few take-away orders and everything has been delicious. Most recently, we ate at the restaurant and ordered the Pineapple Duck Curry and Green Curry - both were absolutely superb.   

It's about time that we have an affordable and delicious option for Thai food in this area.  I am going to spread the word and tell everyone I know about this place so Zabb can continue to pull in business in this   part of town.
author: Penny M.

description: I like this place. It's usually quiet & the food is very good.  Portions can be on the small side, but that's ok for me.
author: Ima S.

description: No napkins or utensils on a $50 takeout order after tipping and asking again if everything was in the bag meaning NAPKINS and UTENSILS!
author: Curtis C.

description:
I don't give 5 stars often, so this is a rarity. now just to clarify, i've been to Zabb maybe 10 times, and i've only gotten curry. but in all honesty, every curry i've tried here is exceptional. Panang last night was some of the best i have ever had anywhere, and the red curry i usually get is superb. so until i try something new, i keep my rating at 5 stars, please do yourself a favor and try Zabb. 

extremely friendly and proud people working there as well!
author: Miki R.

description: This place was recommended by my daughter and i actually like it. The green Curry with avocado was good but i wasn't crazy about the mango fried rice. I ate it but it was nothing special. The service was friendly and i would go back to this place. They recommended a plate for kids that was not what I expected but the kids ate it. It was really not bad and i would return. Its not the best I ever had but its clean and friendly and Thai.
author: shirley c.

description: I really appreciate the fact that they opened in the Excelsior amidst the abundance of Latin fair. Very ballsy move. The exterior doesn't look all that welcoming but once again, we must issue the rule of 'don't judge a book by it's cover' because Zabb's interior had really pretty, inviting decor. I've been here twice and both times I had their pad thai which was plated really nicely and tasted as good as it looked :) It was definitely on par with all of my favorite thai restaurants. Service was super friendly and attentive.  I'll have to return sometime soon to try their lunch special which includes a curry, rice, salad, as well as a side of pad thai. A sampling of all my favorites for roughly $6?? I'm there!
author: Helen L.

description: Just the nicest people and good food.  For some reason, it never seems busy.  Food is fresh and light.  Owner and chef are always on hand to make something special.  AND they deliver
author: Janet L.

description:
Spicy eggplant with chicken and green curry with tofu were both standout fresh and flavorful and good sized portions for $7.95 each. Rice (jasmine or brown) is an extra $1.50/person, as is tea - which struck me as high, considering how inexpensive the entrees were. Then again, the brown rice was perfectly steamed/toasted perfectly for a full, nutty flavor and with such low entree prices, the meal total for 2 was still ridiculously low - and that included a fresh-squeezed carrot juice for my handsome, yet sickly man-friend.

A partially open kitchen displayed some awesome high flame action and the glassware is really nice in an understated, modern way.

So why not 5 stars? No fresh spring rolls - only fried and that, admittedly, bums me out way more than it ought to. I'm just like that I guess.
author: Joanna R.

description:
THANK GOD for this place.  Coming from downtown, there was Thai food everywhere.  I had gotten used to it.  But since moving out to the Outer Mission, there are no Thai food restaurants to be found...  Until I found this one.  AAAAND it's pretty darned tasty too! Oh and did I mention reasonable prices?  That's always a plus...

The only thing I thought was strange was their Spicy eggplant with prawns in a black bean sauce over rice...  Sounds good right?  except the beans are BLACK beans... as in the kind you find in Mexican food!  But I guess for the Outer Mission, that kinda makes sense....
author: Phillip H.

description:
It's true they are Thai, but they don't know how to make green curry, it was as white as coconut milk, with no flavor or spice. 

I'm so sad to report this, as I used to be a big fan of Anna, the owners mother who had a place on 18th St and Mission for years, it was the best thai in the city!!
author: Storey J.

description: really really good lunch deals that allow you to try multiple dishes, love it! Anywhere that I can get an entree and pad thai = win!!
author: Lexie L.

description:
Yes, it is super great that we finally have a Thai place in the Excelsior. Too bad it had to come in expense of the Vietnamese place that was in the spot before. 

Inside, it is simple and clean. The ambiance is quite mellow and quiet. The staff is nice and friendly.

They have a small menu currently, so hopefully they'll be expanding it. Prices are decent for the portions. Most of the dishes we have tried are a little bit too much on the sweet side, creating more of a singular taste. Everything tastes fresh and healthy though. It's just enough to fill you up.

Definitely not the best Thai place in the city, but if you're craving Thai in the Excelsior, this is (the only) place to go.
author: Jenny W.

description:
I don't know what all you haters are talking about, but this place was freaking GOOD! Maybe I just don't know my authentic Thai food? but what I do know is that this food 1) tastes GOOD, 2) is served with a large helping of love, and 3) is presented with care!

I was having a little difficulty finding the place and the owner even walked out on the street and waved to me to help me find it!? If that isn't service, I don't know what is...

So in summary: good food + fresh ingredients + a nice shop = 5 stars!
author: K. C.

description: I ordered delivery here for the first time last week. This may be my new go-to Thai delivery place. The food arrived quickly, piping hot and fresh, and it was delish. Loved the pumpkin curry! Rich tasting, not at all greasy, and didn't leave me with that heavy-I-just-ate-too-rich-food feeling afterwards. Papaya salad was top notch too. Can't wait to try other things on their menu.
author: Lisa M.

description:
I'm finding myself in the Excelsior a lot these days, what between my good friend Eliz R. living there and my good church Mission Bay Community Church having recently moved to the hood.

A few friends and I went to Zabb on a Thursday night, and we had a great meal!  We each ordered a dish to share, and we had way more food on the table than we could eat.  The food was a few notches better than most cheap/quick Thai in the City, IMO; the pumpkin curry and spicy eggplant were particularly well done.  

The place wasn't crowded and it was no problem seating a bigger party, and the wait staff was very friendly and attentive, bringing lots of water and rice refills.  I think we each paid about $13 including tip, which is very reasonable.

This seems like a great addition to the neighborhood.  I have heard that the food has been getting better and better since they opened, and I hope it continues to do so!
author: Megan D.

description:
I really love this place and come here all the time since I discovered it a couple of months ago. The service is always very prompt and the food is never a disappointment. Of the 10 or so dishes I've tried, they all range from above average to absolutely amazing.

The best part is now that my family and I are "regulars", they know exactly how spicy we each like our food and it's the perfect amount of heat each time.

I would say it costs a bit more than your average eatery on this part of Mission Street, but the food, service and decor are worth it.
author: Brad D.

description:
I have been here three times now and will keep coming back. I have had the prig king with tofu, chicken pra ram, and pumpkin curry. All were delish! The owner is usually there and is very gracious and kind, and we had a chance to talk with his wife who was cooking. Very pleasant experience. Prices were a little better than most SF Thai places as well.

Oh yeah and the fried banana and ice cream for dessert was *really* good!
author: Warzie L.

description:
I'm super excited that a Thai place opened in the hood. I've gotten take-out twice and have been very pleased both times. It's got food at King of Thai prices, but the quality and taste are WAY BETTER. I've eaten the standards there like pad-see-ew, pad thai, tom yum gai, and papaya salad and they've all been wonderfu - flavorful with fresh ingredients. I haven't eaten in the restaurant but it's clean and warmly decorated. 

Is it the best Thai food I've ever had? Probably not (hence the 4 stars). But it's good food that I will always come back to. I hope more people eat here because it's a nice addition to the neighborhood and I'd hate to see it go.
author: karen f.

description: We stopped here one day to try it because we love Thai food, but were a little apprehensive when we walked in and felt the unwelcoming and clinical mood of the place. The food was ok, but the atmosphere was cold and depressing. The owner reminded me of the Soup Nazi with his foul mood and smile-less expression. Forget about the food---the creepy owner gives the place a bad vibe and will keep me and my family from ever returning.
author: Penny K.

description: I wrote a review once for Zabbs and it was positive then.  I live in the neighborhood and eat there often.  Food is authentic and fresh.   Always good.  Especially like the Curry Pineapple Duck and what they call "Lucky Bags..."  Mmmm.   And best of all the people are friendly, courteous and pleasant.   Give this a try.  Prices are reasonable.
author: Schuyler R.

description: Everything was great. Had two friends over who said they hated Thai food.they don't any more.Now they are ordering from Zabb's. The appetizer were a hit. One loved the Thai samosas and the other loved the shrimp in a blanket.  The BBQ chicken was heavenly, the cucumber salad delightful and the pad see ew fantastic.I n short..Eat at Zabbs.
author: Mucca J.

description: One of the best Thai Restaurants I've been to. Reasonable, fast, wonderful family owned place with a nice atmosphere. We loved the Spicy eggplant with prawns, Pad Thai, Panang Beef, great appetizers. All in all a great place to eat! Check it out.
author: Phil K.

description:
This location use to be a dirty ass vietnamese restaurant.. glad Zabb's here now. The restaurant has really cute decor and very friendly waiters.
 
I like to get the lucky bags for the appetizer and the spicy crispy basil chicken with steamed rice. YUMMY! I haven't tried a lot of other dishes besides the pad thai (which i didn't like) and the pad see ew (don't remember if i liked it or not)
author: Kristol C.

description:
w00t!!! Zabb FTW!!1!

Seriously, as a resident of the Excelsior for the past few years, I'm so psyched we have this place. Not to diss El Farolito (whose burritos I love), but this 'hood is not up the cuisine standards of most of the rest of the city. I'm hoping Zabb is the beginning of a trend to improve that. Zabb might get four stars from me elsewhere, but I'm giving it a bonus star for convenience and filling an important food niche in my neighborhood.

Come here for much better-than-average Thai food and some interesting preparations (Thai Samosas, Spicy Beef Salad). You probably know most of the entrees and apps, but check the menu for a few that are different. I've eaten here a bunch, and the food is always fresh, never oily, and their hot dishes are good hurt (you might ask for extra spicy if you really like things hot). Everyone who works there is super nice, too (even the guy who occasionally complains if you order for delivery a bit too late). 

People of the Excelsior, you must support Zabb.
author: Chris H.

description:
I live within one block of this place and was very excited when it opened up.  I've been to Zabb many, many times and have ordered take out on numerous occassions too.  The papaya salad is the best I've had and they also have a great list of curries.  

The owner, Ben, is very friendly and waves everytime I walk by, even if I'm not eating there.  I'm glad this restaurant is getting busier because I thought it might not make it when it first opened.  

Go try it!!!
author: Joshua G.

description: After receiving hostile messages from Alex K. regarding my earlier review of Zabb, I will have to deduct an additional star.  Although he claims not to be affiliated with Zabb, his messages have made my experience with Zabb as a whole even more unpleasant.
author: Grace W.

description:
Excellent Pad Thai and chicken Curry.

The atmosphere looks nice, but certainly no Mekong....
author: Alberto L.

description: i'm glad to have a thai restaurant so close to my house, but i must say that i was really disappointed with the som tum (green papaya salad) and the prices. Food was decent but the portions were pretty small, especially for the price. I'm sure I'll still probably go back though some time i need thai and dusit isn't open.
author: Geryon R.

description:
This place is just OK, the service is just OK as well

They have all the standard Thai meals, nothing really stands out.

It's usually empty is my main concern, if this was exceptional Thai food it would stand out more. Also the prices are kind of high for what it is and the neighborhood it's in. I think it was like $9 for green curry without rice, why don't they include rice with the meals??
author: Molly M.

description: I've only eaten here one time, and that one time was alright  it wasn't too bad either. Im a big fan of Thai food and this restaurant I must say does not taste like any other Thai restaurant i've been to. They make their food spicy and there's just something different about the taste. The pad thai is not too good, its dry and not enough peanut butter. Kinda lacks that whole pad thai taste, the nice creamy peanut butter sauce taste that you just love. The pumpkin curry should be called saucy curry, they were really stingy with the pumpkin and that made me really sad. The place used to be a dark Vietnamese restaurant, though im not too fond of this restaurant and was disappointed with the results, one positive thing i could say is that the place has brightened up a bit. I don't know yet, maybe i have yet to give this restaurant another chance.
author: Clementine D.

description: Food was really good (Pad see ew), service was a touch slow, but overall good experience, would go back.
author: Kyle B.

description: Maybe my initial 5 stars was a little over-the-top. I was just very excited oto have a Thai restaurant that I could walk too that was actually pretty good. Zabb can be very good, but it is a little inconsistent. Got take-out here a while ago that was 3 stars at best, and the last time we dined in we were a little shocked at the skimpy serving sizes. Don't get me wrong though- Zabb is a pretty safe bet and can be intermittently excellent, but if I couldn't walk to it I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here very often and it really isn't consistent enough to warrant 5 stars.
author: Brian H.

description: I lurv this place. They are friendly, the food is great and there is never a wait. The pumpkin curry is addictive and if you have it once you begin to crave it fortnightly. So be warned. And the pad thai and I hate pad thai.... I could go on... just go check it out already!
author: John K.

description:
thai in the excelsior? what's the world coming to?!?!

zabb cuisine is out of place in the excelsior, surrounded by taquerias, 99 cent stores, and liquor stores.  i had my reservations about coming here as i thought the food would be so-so since it's the only thai place in the excelsior, and they could cook it however they wanted and people would still come rather than drive to the sunset or downtown.

we got there around 9pm and the place was empty.  "bad sign" i thought to myself.  

i remember the old vietnamese restaurant that used to be here...really old and dirty.  i thought that the new decor was really, really nice.  the only thing i would add to it is a little more lighting.

we were greeted by the owner, who gave us our menus and returned almost immediately with water for the table.  before ordering i chit-chat-ed with the owner who told me that they've been there for about 3.5 months and that business is picking up.  he said that it might not look like it, since the restaurant was empty, but that around 5-8, the place is pretty much filled.

personally, i always judge a thai restaurant by 3 basic dishes.  if a restaurant can't make these staples right, the other dishes probably taste like crap:

curry - we had the yellow curry with chicken.  the curry had a nice sweetness to it, and lots of onions and sliced chicken, which i love.

pad thai - the pad thai noodles were not as thick as king of thai's noodles, but there were lots of shrimp, and the flavor was on par with the better thai restaurants that i've tasted.  definitely, use the lime that they put on the plate.

pad ka praw (basil chicken) - they usually served the chicken sliced, and we asked for it ground, and they said, no problem.  we had it mild, so it wasn't too hot, lots of basil and the chicken was cooked and ground perfectly.

the owner and his wait staff were really nice and answered all the questions i had.

i really, really, really do hope this place stays in business, cause now i know that i don't have to drive very far to get really good thai.

on a last note, they do deliver, but only in area.
author: Ray R.

description:
No biggie, Joe H. but this place definitely was NOT originally a Thai restaurant.  It was a Vietnamese Joint, and pretty damn popular one at that, despite a hidiously grimey and uninviting interior (the food was much better than the ambiance).

But this review isn't about the previous eatery, it's about Zabb, the location's new tenant.  Talk about a face-lift.    The new owners have turned an eyesore into a simple but very pleasant and inviting space.

We've tried a number of the dishes and so far so good.  One item I've never encountered before in a Thai place is the "Lucky Bag" appetizer.  It's really tasty and worth trying.  The spicy Eggplant is was excellent, and the Pad Kee Mao also passably tasty.  The coconut soup was good as was the Panang Curry, although I'll try the chicken version next time over the beef.  If you are a heat fiend, as in Chili spice, you have to convince the staff that you're up to the task.  They've made the deliberate ,and my opinion, smart decision to keep the heat factor low until they get a read of their clientelle.  Hey if you want to kill yourself, they do stock the fresh thai chili's, which you'll have to ask for.

The Manager Ben and his staff, including the cook are super, super friendly.  After a brief chat the first time I ate there, Ben remembered my name when I returned with my wife in tow and also what I had ordered  ("No pad kee mao this time, ok?", said with a smile).  Even if this may be partially an attempt to retain return customers, it can't help but make one feel good.

This restaurant is yet another example of the good food values available in this city . Our initial heartbreak at the closing of a restaurant we frequented almost weekly  is on the mend.  Zabb's staff will get to know us very well indeed.   Based on value for the whole experience I give it four stars (food alone is nearer 3 1/2 stars).  

They now take credit cards and they're working on the beer/wine license.  According to the manager it is ok to BYOAlcohol as long as it's in a bag.
author: Ian N.

description: I am so happy Zabb Cuisine is near my house! Ordered spicy eggplant tofu, pumpkin curry and coconut soup, all excellent! I will be back for sure!
author: lucia p.

description: This place is great! I love having this Thai place in my neighborhood! Their delivery is really fast and the food is really good! It is actually spicy on the dishes it states as spicy, but in a good way, not over the top- and I am fairly sensitive! They have excellent service when you eat in as well.
author: Allison T.

description: This place is okay.  The fried papaya appetizer was bland, the pad thai had a weird bbq-ketchup flavor, but the papaya salad was pretty good.  Friendly service though.  Thai people in the kitchen...but not sure why the food didn't taste Thai...
author: Dylan's Aunt E.

description: Excellnt food, reasonable prices, and fast and friendly service. Always my family's first response to the question "Where should we eat?"
author: Jo M.

description: When Zabb opened two years ago, I was one of many yelpers who lauded the opening of a good thai neighborhood restaurant. I am sad to say that It has steadily gone down hill and my experience from two days ago convinced me that I am not going back. Two days ago, I ordered a thai red curry with chicken and basil noodles with pork. I got a tough chewy pork noodle dish with too much vinegar and i got a beef red curry instead of chicken. I do not eat beef or ever bring it home. But i have tasted it in the past  and this beef was basically inedible. While their portions have gotten bigger, their quality has gone down and it is the first time that I have had to throw away leftovers. I do hope they spruce up their act but they have lost one customer for sure.
author: ash s.

description: One of the only places I order takeout from in my neighborhood.  I love the green avocado curry here.  The spicy eggplant is good too.  Tasty, fresh, not greasy or heavy at all.  I wish the curry had more heat but I guess I'll ask next time.  The owners seem really genuinely nice and went out of their way to take good care of us - they even stuck a heat lamp next to our table to warm us up last time we were in because it was cold outside!  Prices are waaaay more reasonable than Osha Thai and although its not as trendy, it has a great atmosphere once you get inside.
author: Holly B.

description: I love this place. Some of the best Pad Thai I've ever had. And their spring rolls always disappear immediately.
author: K M.

description: just went there for the first time after the new place opened a year ago and had the bbq chicken(ok), coconut soup was yummy and thai iced tea was refreshing. My vegetarian friend had the spicy crispy tofu and red soup and enjoyed it. the place was empty on sunday afternoon and may be priced above the rest of the cheap eats in the area but reasonable for SF and definately an upgrade on food in the excelsior. will have to try again soon.
author: tomohisa w.

description:
i've drove by this place several times, and made a mental note to try it out one day.  it's nice to have a thai restaurant that is in the excelsior, and not have to drive into the mission to have good thai.

we came in on a cold sunday night, and happened to be the only patrons at the time.  the servers were like hawks and quick to take our order, refill our water, and clear our dishes as we transitioned from our soup to the next entree.  

we enjoyed the tom kah and spicy eggplant with tofu.  i can't wait to try their other dishes.  my only gripe is that i asked for my eggplant dish to be spicy, and it wasn't.  maybe next time i'll put more emphasis on how hot i want it.

they also deliver around the area with a $20 minimum.
author: Sheri N.

description: Very nice to have a Thai place in the neighborhood now..Very good food and the service is always great...I love, love, love the pad si ew...Don't forget to order some Zato!
author: Chai S.

description: Just ordered takeout for the first time. Tasty tasty food. Incredibly fast delivery. So glad to have found this place!
author: Sandy B.

description: Zabb gets four-stars for the personable service and for being brave to take a chance and bring something different to my neighborhood. We desperately need more restaurants like this, affordable, great service and a clean and attractive setting. They have been open less than a month but already have the locals returning. Check them out if you live in the Excelsior/Outer Mission. I love the pumpkin curry.
author: Cristy J.

description: A Thai restaurant in the Excelsior is just what the doctor ordered. This neighborhood has a heavy influx of Mexican and Salvadorean food, and so some change is welcome. I got the beef pad-see-ew from here and it was phenomenal. The decor is very relaxing, but the hip-hop and rock music playing from the stereo makes it seem like the owners are trying too hard to draw a younger crowd. I'd rather hear some native Thai music for a more soothing dining experience. Other than that, this is my new nighborhood Thai joint and I won't be leaving anytime soon.
author: Maurice R.

description:
Ahhhhh!  It's sooooo nice to finally have another Asian cuisine choice, what San Francisco is known for, in the Excelsior -- it's nice to feel part of the City for a change!  This restaurant is in par with other restaurants in the established restaurant-neighborhoods (i.e., Bernal Heights, Noe Valley, Sunset, etc.) with it's ambience, quality of food, and service.

So YELPERS in the Excelsior, let's keep this place in business so other restaurants in ths caliber will follow. (I'm tired of all the hispanic food here -- I don't understand why new ones keep cropping up -- we've got too much)   Keep coming!

I'm here at least once a week and always very satisfied.

Thanks for opening Zabb Cuisine -- I really appreciate you.
author: Vicky M.

description: Something happened! Their food is now delicious. It was fine before but now....great! Spicy eggplant was succulent and the curries were fab.
author: Miss H.

description: I'm always happy when a new (good) restaurant opens in the Excelsior, and Zabb is one that I want to keep open. Their food is great, the service is excellent, and they are kid-friendly to the extreme. Zabb, and Sushi Raw down the street, are vital additions to this neighborhood.
author: Billy Ray V.

description: I love Thai food.  This was pretty mediocre.  The pad thai was rather borning - it definitely needed more chilis.  no lime to squeeze on the pad thai was annoying.  The pumpkin curry was.... hmmm.... unremarkable.  I have definitely had better.  I love supporting local spots but unless they figure out how to kick up the flavor... we will probably not be going back for our thai cravings.
author: samantha D.

description: It took a long time for my wife and I to get here, because we loved the Pho that was served before the change in ownership.  Now that we've finally come by we love it.  it's close, the prices are good, the food is tasty and the service is attentive.  If you live nearby, and even if you don't, come and check it out!
author: Matt B.

description: finally, a thai cuisine in the excelsior!!!! loveeee it here. living and working in the neighborhood, you dont get that much food variety. sure you see some chinese, mexican, and filipino restaurants, but thas about it. i ordered the pad see yew (beef) with a pinch of spice and it was scrumptous deli-yumtous. it was fast and quick and they cook it right in front of you. i recommend you try it sometime. its worth your taste buds!!!
author: Abby A.

description: Great place!  Love the people (really nice and thoughtful).  Its a clean place with good food that's not pricey.   We love it!
author: Lorena R.

description: my friend raves and raves and raves about how awesome this place is. since it's near his house he eats there almost all the time. i went and had the pumpkin curry and it was super yummy. it felt a little awkward because he sometimes sees the staff out in the local bars as well.  but food = good. i would like to go back.
author: amanda d.

description: 5 stars for a thai place in the neighborhood, 3.8 on the food.  I wouldn't drive across the city to eat here, but having it in the neighborhood is incredible.  Friendly staff, average pricing.
author: John D.

description: I'm delighted to have this tranquil, delicious restaurant in my neighborhood.  WIth excellent service, tasteful decor, and delectable dishes, all that is missing is more customers to enliven the vibe!  My boyfriend and I come here frequently when we are looking for a slightly more upscale respite from taquerias and we always leave with bright smiles inspired by happy stomachs.  It does seem that the portions are a bit small for the price compared to other Thai favorites in the city, but I certainly hope that this place will thrive and encourage other new restaurants and businesses to open in the area.
author: L B.

description: I dig this place. I bring the take out containers back for refills because I'm a conservation freak and they don't treat me like I'm a Martian. The folks are friendly and fast every time. The spot is elegant and welcoming but also fits in our neighborhood for the most part. It might be a little less affordable than the rest of our dinner spots, but it's great for lunch.
author: r. k.

description: i'm going out on a limb with the 5 stars.  i have only been once, for lunch, so i can't fully say it is a solid 5 star  restaurant but my one experience was 5 stars.  had a thai ice tea...and i forgot to ask if they make it with coconut milk...damnit...but it was yummy with cow juice.  had the tom kha chicken which was really, really great.  full of veggies and would have been just as good without the chicken (chickens are gross).  i plan on eating this soup every time i am sick.  it is delicious awesomeness.  i had the sweet and sour pork for lunch.  it wasn't wicked sweet like it could have been and was spiced nicely.  up until this point it would have been 4 stars but after we left and got in the car across the street i realized we didn't get a take out menu.   so we flipped a bitch and i ran up to the door.  and there was homeboy...standing in the doorway...with a take out menu.  he laughed and i laughed and we had a moment.  i look forward to eating here again.
author: Katie H.
